In GODMODE engine (card draw + discount), drew 30 cards over 7 generations. Card draw + discount = GODMODE pattern: the most powerful engine archetype.
Spin-off Department.when_to_pick: Always draft early. Play gen 1-2 for maximum draw value. Never pass in draft.

Olympus Conference.name: Olympus Conference
Olympus Conference.economy: Cost 10+3=13 MC (steel payable). Value: 1 VP (5) + Science+Earth+Building tags (6-10) + free card every 2 science tags. After 4 science tags = 2 free cards (6-8 MC).
Olympus Conference.reasoning: Incredible triple-tag card with card draw engine. Not quite Mars University (which swaps every science tag vs every other), but the Earth+Building+Science tags make it arguably better in some dimensions. shai_aus gives it 30 upvotes calling it amazing. Steel-payable, no requirements, 1 VP. One of the best engine cards in the game. [BonelessDota] 'Best card for card strategy.' Core GODMODE piece. Science tag draw accumulates over many plays. Effect-based draw > action-based draw.
Olympus Conference.when_to_pick: Always. High first-pick priority. Play early to maximize card draw. The triple-tag is unmatched.

Giant Ice Asteroid.name: Giant Ice Asteroid
Giant Ice Asteroid.economy: 36 MC (ti payable) + 3 MC card = 39 MC cost. Returns: 2 TR temp (~14.4 MC) + 2 oceans (2 TR ~14.4 MC + 2 placement bonuses ~6 MC) + plant attack. Total ~35+ MC in TR + bonuses. Space+Event tags.
Giant Ice Asteroid.reasoning: One of the best space events — massively efficient terraforming in a single action. 4 TR for 39 MC = 9.75 MC per TR, which is good value. The 2 oceans provide placement bonuses and trigger ocean requirements. Ti payable with Phobolog makes this absurdly efficient. The plant attack is a bonus (take-that penalty applies in 3P but it's not the core value). Per community, this is a top-tier event card.
Giant Ice Asteroid.when_to_pick: Almost always when seen. Especially powerful when ocean placement bonuses and temperature bonuses are available.

L1 Trade Terminal.name: L1 Trade Terminal
L1 Trade Terminal.economy: 25 MC + 3 MC card = 28 MC. Space tag, 2 VP. Effect: +2 colony track steps per trade = +6-8 MC value per trade. Over 5+ trades = 30-40 MC+ value. Also adds resources to 3 different cards.
L1 Trade Terminal.reasoning: Extremely powerful colony synergy card that generates massive recurring value. Each trade gives +2 track steps worth 6-8 MC, and with a second trade fleet this doubles. Even over 3-4 trades the card pays for itself. The 2 VP and resource placement are gravy. Space tag for titanium payment. One of the strongest Prelude 2 additions.
L1 Trade Terminal.when_to_pick: Always keep in opening hand. Top draft priority in Colony games. The earlier you play this, the more value it generates.

Protected Habitats.name: Protected Habitats
Protected Habitats.economy: 8 MC total (5+3) for protection of all plants, animals, microbes. Blocks Virus (4 plant swing), asteroids (3-6 plants), Predators, Ants. Effective value easily 10-20+ MC over a game.
Protected Habitats.reasoning: Cheap, easy to play, and extremely impactful. icehawk84 calls it S-tier. In 3P, it redirects all plant attacks to opponents, which is a double benefit. No tags is a downside, but the protection value is enormous for any plant-based strategy. shai_aus and FieldMouse007 both rate it very highly. Slightly below S because in all-expansion format attack density is lower.
Protected Habitats.when_to_pick: Almost always draft - deny it to opponents even if you don't need it. Play when you have plants/animals worth protecting.

Cutting Edge Technology.name: Cutting Edge Technology
Cutting Edge Technology.economy: 12+3=15 MC for -2 MC per requirement card + 1 VP (5 MC) + Science tag (3-5 MC). At ~4-5 requirement cards played = 8-10 MC saved. Total value ~18-20 MC for 15 MC cost. Net +3-5 MC plus tag and VP.
Cutting Edge Technology.reasoning: One of the best engine cards in the game. The -2 MC discount on every requirement card is enormous in all-expansion games where ~50-60% of project cards have requirements. Plays even better with Adaptation Technology and Special Design. The Science tag is premium. 1 VP rounds it out. Best played gen 1-2 where the cumulative savings compound. In 3P/WGT with 8-9 gen games, expect 4-6 triggers minimum. This is a top engine piece that every player wants.
Cutting Edge Technology.when_to_pick: Always pick gen 1-3 if offered. Counter-draft priority. Even gen 4-5 with 3+ requirement cards in hand it is worth it. Science tag synergies make it even better.

Ecological Zone.name: Ecological Zone
Ecological Zone.economy: 12 MC + 3 MC card = 15 MC cost. Returns: tile placement (~4-6 MC), starts with 1 animal (counts own 2 tags), Plant+Animal tags (~3 MC). Typically accumulates 3-4 VP = 15-20 MC. With bio combos: 5+ VP.
Ecological Zone.reasoning: One of the best combo cards in the game. Per shai_aus, it's a vital part of the 'holy Plant Trinity' with Viral Enhancers and Decomposers. Per ad_hocNC, it's the best point card in base game. The dual Plant+Animal tags are incredible for milestones (Ecologist, NRA) and trigger both bio-tag accumulator chains. The tile placement adds additional value. Easily 3-4 VP even without heavy combos.
Ecological Zone.when_to_pick: High priority whenever you have or plan for a greenery. Core card for bio-tag strategies. Hate-draft from plant players.

AI Central.name: AI Central
AI Central.economy: 21+3=24 MC + ~7 MC energy-prod = 31 MC effective. Action: draw 2 cards/gen = 6-8 MC value/gen. 1 VP = 5 MC. Payoff in ~4 gens. Science+Building tags worth ~4 MC.
AI Central.reasoning: One of the strongest card-draw engines in the game. 2 free cards per gen is enormous value for engine players. However, as COTD commenters note, it is somewhat overrated -- it needs 3 Science tags, energy production, and a strong economy to play the drawn cards. Played gen 3-4 with good economy it is top-tier; gen 6+ it is mediocre. The high setup cost means it is not always playable. [BonelessDota] A-S tier. Action-based draw (2 cards/gen) is powerful but strictly weaker than effect-based draw (Spin-off, Mars University) which triggers more often. Still a core engine card.
AI Central.when_to_pick: When you already have 2+ Science tags and energy production, and expect a longer game. Counter-draft to deny engine players.

Deimos Down.name: Deimos Down
Deimos Down.economy: 31 MC (ti payable) + 3 MC card = 34 MC cost. Returns: 3 TR (~21.6 MC) + 4 steel (~8 MC) + plant attack (~8 MC value in 3P, less due to take-that). Effective cost vs 3 SP asteroids: 34 vs 42 MC.
Deimos Down.reasoning: One of the best space events in the game. 3 temperature raises for 34 MC is significantly cheaper than standard projects. The 4 steel returned partially offsets the cost. Plant removal is a bonus (take-that penalty mitigated because the core value is in terraforming, not the attack). Ti payable makes it even more efficient. Per shai_aus and ad_hocNC, it's a top 10 base game card.
Deimos Down.when_to_pick: Almost always when seen. Best early for heat production bonuses, but good at any point for efficient temperature rushing.

Earth Office.name: Earth Office
Earth Office.economy: 1 MC + 3 MC card = 4 MC cost. Effect: -3 MC per Earth tag played. Pays for itself in 2 Earth tags. With 4-6 Earth tags: 12-18 MC saved = huge profit.
Earth Office.reasoning: Underpriced card that easily pays for itself. Per icehawk84, it's ridiculously strong for Point Luna and Teractor. Per FieldMouse007, it pays for itself in 2 Earth tags and everything after is pure profit. The Earth tag itself counts toward other Earth synergies. At 4 MC total cost, the risk of picking it up is minimal even if you only play 2-3 more Earth tags.
Earth Office.when_to_pick: Almost always pick early. Even as speculation on future Earth tags, the cost is trivially low.

Large Convoy.name: Large Convoy
Large Convoy.economy: 36 MC + 3 MC card = 39 MC. 2 VP + ocean (TR + bonus ~9 MC) + 2 cards (~6 MC) + 5 plants or 4 animals on 1VP animal (2-4 VP = 10-20 MC). Full value with 1VP animal: ~45-55 MC value. Ti-payable, heavy discounts.
Large Convoy.reasoning: Premier late-game point bomb, especially with a 1VP animal card. The Earth+Space event tags enable massive discounts making the high cost manageable. With a 1VP animal, the 4 animals = 4 VP making the total output 7+ VP plus cards and ocean. Even the plant mode is reasonable mid-game with oxygen not maxed. High draft priority card that shapes strategy.
Large Convoy.when_to_pick: Keep from opening hand if you expect to find 1VP animal. High draft priority. Excellent last-gen titanium dump.

Psychrophiles.name: Psychrophiles
Psychrophiles.economy: 5 MC total (2+3) for effectively ~2 MC/gen discount on plant cards + Microbe tag + stall action. icehawk84 calls it 'most impactful card under 5 MC.'
Psychrophiles.reasoning: Extremely cheap and high value. Acts as ~2 MC production specifically for plant cards, which are common in any strategy. Max -20C requirement ensures early game play only. Microbe tag adds Ecologist/Decomposers synergy. Universally praised in COTD. One of the best low-cost cards in the game.
Psychrophiles.when_to_pick: Always draft if temp <= -20C. Play immediately. Loses value rapidly as temperature rises.

Viral Enhancers.name: Viral Enhancers
Viral Enhancers.economy: 9+3=12 MC for effect: +1 plant or +1 resource per bio tag played. Science+Microbe tags (~5-7 MC). With 5 bio tags after: ~5 plants (10 MC) + 2-3 animal VP (10-15 MC). Science tag bonus.
Viral Enhancers.reasoning: icehawk84 says 'S tier card.' shai_aus says 'one of the best combo cards.' benbever details how just 3 bio tags + 1 animal card already pays it back. The Science+Microbe dual tag is excellent. Every plant/animal/microbe tag gives value. Even moderate bio play yields great returns. Only skip if completely non-bio strategy.
Viral Enhancers.when_to_pick: Almost always. Draft priority. Science tag alone justifies early play. Effect compounds beautifully with bio engine.

Anti-Gravity Technology.name: Anti-Gravity Technology
Anti-Gravity Technology.economy: 14+3=17 MC for 3 VP (15 MC) + Science tag (3-5 MC) + -2 MC discount on all cards (massive in engine). Even without discount, 3VP for 17 MC = excellent.
Anti-Gravity Technology.reasoning: Objectively one of the best cards if you can play it. 3 VP for 17 MC is already strong, and the -2 MC discount is game-changing for engine players. The 7 Science tag requirement is the main barrier -- in all-expansion 3P games it is more achievable than in base game. However, as COTD notes, getting to 7 Science tags AND having AGT in hand at the right time is rare. When it works, it is S-tier. The difficulty drops it to A. [BonelessDota] Top-tier greedy card. -2 MC on cards costing 15+ MC. Part of GODMODE engine when combined with card draw effects.
Anti-Gravity Technology.when_to_pick: Always keep if you see it. Even if you cannot play it, counter-draft to deny the science player.

Conscription.name: Conscription
Conscription.economy: 5+3=8 MC cost. -16 MC discount on next card. Net: +8 MC gain - 1 VP (5 MC late-game). Net +3-8 MC depending on timing. Earth tag (2-3 MC) adds value.
Conscription.reasoning: Like Indentured Workers on steroids. Net 8 MC for -1 VP is excellent early-mid game (8 MC >> 1 VP in gens 1-5). The Earth tag adds synergy with Point Luna, Earth Office, Teractor. The 2 Earth tag requirement is achievable with preludes and corporations. Even late game, enabling a 16+ MC card for cheap has significant value. The -1 VP is negligible when the discount enables a powerful play. One of the best discount events.
Conscription.when_to_pick: When you have 2 Earth tags and a 16+ MC card to play. Almost always worth it gens 1-6.

Deimos Down:promo.name: Deimos Down:promo
Deimos Down:promo.economy: 31 MC (ti payable) + 3 MC card = 34 MC cost. Returns: 3 TR (~21.6 MC) + 4 steel (~8 MC) + tile placement bonus + plant attack (6 instead of 8). Similar economics to original with tile bonus.
Deimos Down:promo.reasoning: Promo revision of Deimos Down — slightly different (tile placement added, plant removal reduced to 6). The tile placement is a net positive, making this arguably equal to or slightly better than the original depending on available spots. Same core strengths: efficient 3-temperature raise with ti payability.
Deimos Down:promo.when_to_pick: Same as original Deimos Down — almost always draft when seen.

Imported Nitrogen.name: Imported Nitrogen
Imported Nitrogen.economy: 23 MC + 3 MC card = 26 MC. 1 TR (~7 MC) + 4 plants (~8 MC half greenery) + 3 microbes (1-2 VP = 5-10 MC) + 2 animals (2 VP = 10 MC on 1VP animal). Max: ~35 MC value. Ti-payable, heavy discounts possible.
Imported Nitrogen.reasoning: One of the best late-game point bombs when you have a 1VP animal card. Earth+Space event tags enable the most discounts in the game. With a 1VP animal, it's potentially 5-6 points for a heavily discounted cost. Even mid-game with oxygen not maxed, the plants can become a greenery for 2 TR total. Requires setup but ceiling is very high.
Imported Nitrogen.when_to_pick: High draft priority. Keep from opening hand if you expect to find animal/microbe targets. Best with 1VP animal card.

Nuclear Zone.name: Nuclear Zone
Nuclear Zone.economy: Cost 10+3=13 MC. Value: 2 temp (2 TR = 14.8) + placement bonus (2-6) + Earth tag (2-3) + tile teleport (variable). Minus 2 VP (= -10). Net: ~9-14 MC.
Nuclear Zone.reasoning: Extremely efficient temperature raise. shai_aus (34 upvotes) and icehawk84 (21 upvotes) both rate it highly. The -2 VP is offset by the 2 TR, making it roughly VP-neutral while giving income, placement bonus, teleport tile, and an Earth tag. Great for game control -- ending the game when ahead, snatching temp bonuses. ad_hocNC calls it his favourite card.
Nuclear Zone.when_to_pick: Almost always draft. Excellent for terraformers, good tile teleport for anyone. Even engine players can use it to deny opponents.

Optimal Aerobraking.name: Optimal Aerobraking
Optimal Aerobraking.economy: Cost 7+3=10 MC. Value: Space tag (1-2) + 3 MC + 3 heat (~3.6 MC) per space event = ~6.6 MC per trigger. Breaks even at 2 space events. After 4 events = +16 MC.
Optimal Aerobraking.reasoning: Excellent rebate card. Space events are among the strongest cards in the game, and this adds pure value to already-good plays. shai_aus (24 upvotes) and benbever both rate it highly. Breaks even after just 2 space events. The heat helps with temperature racing. Works for both engine and rush strategies.
Optimal Aerobraking.when_to_pick: Early game with space events in hand or planned. Even mid-game it's good if you expect 2+ more space events.

Research.name: Research
Research.economy: 14 MC total (11+3) for 2 Science tags (~8 MC) + 2 cards (~8 MC) + 1 VP (~5 MC). Total value ~21 MC. Excellent efficiency.
Research.reasoning: Premium science engine card. Double Science tag is incredibly valuable for unlocking AI Central, Mass Converter, AGT, and Science milestones/awards. 2 cards + 1 VP on top makes it near-always worth drafting. Mars University combo draws 4 cards total. Community consensus rates it very highly.
Research.when_to_pick: Almost always draft. Play mid-game when science tags enable payoff cards. Early keep for science engine.

Space Port.name: Space Port
Space Port.economy: 25 MC total (22+3) + 1 energy prod for city (~14 MC) + 4 MC-prod (~20 MC) + trade fleet (~10+ MC/gen) + City+Building tags. Req: 1 colony. Steel payable.
Space Port.reasoning: Extra trade fleet is incredibly valuable. Worst of the 3 trade fleet cards per COTD but still very strong. City provides board presence and VP potential. 4 MC-prod helps economy. -1 energy is painful when you need energy for double trading. Steel payable. COTD consensus: 'A-tier at minimum.'
Space Port.when_to_pick: Draft always when colonies are in play. Play when you have a colony and can manage the energy cost.

Terraforming Ganymede.name: Terraforming Ganymede
Terraforming Ganymede.economy: 33+3=36 MC (ti-payable) for N TR + 2 VP where N = Jovian tags including this. At 3 Jovian tags: 3 TR (21 MC) + 2 VP (10 MC) = 31 MC. At 5+ tags: absurdly good. Jovian+Space tags worth ~5 MC.
Terraforming Ganymede.reasoning: The Jovian capstone card. With 4+ Jovian tags this is one of the best cards in the game. shai_aus picks it just to deny Jovian players. benbever notes with 5+ tags and wild tags it's 10+ points. Even at 3 tags it's a reasonable ti-payable closer. High hate-draft priority in 3P.
Terraforming Ganymede.when_to_pick: Draft when 3+ Jovian tags are in your line, or to deny opponents. Play last gen for maximum tag count. Ti-payable makes it affordable.

Imported Hydrogen.name: Imported Hydrogen
Imported Hydrogen.economy: 16+3=19 MC for 1 ocean (12 MC + 1 TR = 7 MC = 19 MC) + flexible resources (3 plants = 2.4 MC, or 3 microbes = 3-6 MC, or 2 animals = 10 MC VP). Earth+Space tags worth 3-5 MC. Ti-payable. Net +5-15 MC depending on resource choice.
Imported Hydrogen.reasoning: Triple-function card with ocean placement plus flexible resource placement. The Space+Earth tags are both premium and ti-payable means the effective cost drops to ~13-15 MC. With animal placement (Birds, Fish, Predators) this is effectively 2 VP + ocean for ~15 MC which is outstanding. Even the plant option is decent for greenery push. One of the best events in the game because it provides both terraforming and VP engine fuel in one action.
Imported Hydrogen.when_to_pick: Anytime you have animal or microbe placement targets. Even without targets, the ocean + plants + double tag makes it strong gen 1-4. Ti-payable makes it a Space engine staple.

Arctic Algae.name: Arctic Algae
Arctic Algae.economy: 12+3=15 MC for Plant tag (1-2 MC) + 1 plant (2 MC) + effect: 2 plants per ocean placed. If 5+ oceans after play: 10+ plants = 1+ greenery (8+ MC value).
Arctic Algae.reasoning: Extremely strong when played before many oceans. 2 plants per ocean placed by anyone gives huge value -- if 5 oceans come after you play this, that is 10 plants (more than a greenery). The plants come all at once when oceans drop, making them harder to attack. Max -12C requirement can be tricky -- sometimes temperature races past it before you play. In 3P with preludes, a great gen 1 card. [BonelessDota/ThreadPacifist] Both experts agree: 'too good even with 3 oceans already down', 'always take'. 2 plants per ocean placed by ANY player = massive value in 3P where ~9 oceans are placed. One of the best passive plant engines.
Arctic Algae.when_to_pick: Gen 1 starting hand if -12C is met. High priority -- the earlier you play it, the more oceans you catch.

Advanced Ecosystems.name: Advanced Ecosystems
Advanced Ecosystems.economy: 11+3=14 MC for 3 VP (15 MC). Triple tag (Plant+Microbe+Animal) worth 3-6 MC in synergies. With Decomposers+Eco Zone: +2 VP. With Viral Enhancers: +3 plants.
Advanced Ecosystems.reasoning: 3 VP for 14 MC is one of the best VP-per-MC ratios in the game. The triple bio-tag triggers massive combos with Decomposers, Ecological Zone, Viral Enhancers, GMO Contract, and Splice. The requirement (1 of each bio tag) is achievable in all-expansion games. High counter-draft priority. Slightly below A-tier because the requirement can sometimes be hard to meet.
Advanced Ecosystems.when_to_pick: When you have or expect to have Plant+Microbe+Animal tags. Counter-draft even if you cannot play it to deny opponents 3+ VP.

Dusk Laser Mining.name: Dusk Laser Mining
Dusk Laser Mining.economy: 8 MC (ti payable) + 3 MC card + ~7 MC energy prod = ~18 MC cost. Returns: 4 ti (~12 MC immediate) + 1 ti-prod (~12.5 MC gen1) + Space tag (~2 MC). Effectively ~4-6 MC for ti-prod after ti rebate.
Dusk Laser Mining.reasoning: Disgusting value if you have energy production to spare. The 4 titanium returned nearly pays for the entire card, making the ti-prod almost free. Per shai_aus, 'disgustingly good value.' Per benbever, with Phobolog or Advanced Alloys, you pay 2 ti + 3 MC and get 4 ti (worth 16) back immediately. The 2 Science tag requirement is manageable for engine players who already have science tags.
Dusk Laser Mining.when_to_pick: Gen 1-3 with 2 science tags and spare energy production. Still good mid-game due to instant ti rebate.

Indentured Workers.name: Indentured Workers
Indentured Workers.economy: 0 MC (or 3 MC drafted) + 1 VP penalty. Gain 8 MC discount on next card. Net: +5 MC (drafted) or +7 MC (free draw) minus 1 VP (~5 MC mid-game). Still positive tempo.
Indentured Workers.reasoning: Excellent tempo card that enables playing key cards a generation earlier. The -1 VP is easily worth 5-8 MC of immediate tempo, especially early game where money is tight. Best use is discounting Earth Catapult or other expensive engine pieces. With IC/Media Group it becomes even better. One of the most underrated cards by newer players. [BonelessDota] 'Literally always keep in opening hand.' The 8 MC discount with accumulated interest over the game = 5+ MC real value. The -1 VP is irrelevant early game (1 VP < 1 MC gen 1). One of the best opening hand cards.
Indentured Workers.when_to_pick: Almost always keep in opening hand. High draft priority for enabling expensive early plays. Even better as a free draw.

Mangrove.name: Mangrove
Mangrove.economy: Cost 12+3=15 MC. Value: 1 greenery (TR if O2 not maxed = 7-7.4) + 1 VP (5) + placement bonus (2-4) + Plant tag (1-2). Total ~15-19 MC. Great efficiency.
Mangrove.reasoning: One of the best VP cards in the game. Cheap greenery on ocean space with 1 VP printed. If oxygen isn't maxed, you get TR + VP + placement bonuses for very little. The 4C requirement is easy to meet. COTD experts universally praise it. Plant tag adds value for NRA/Insects synergy.
Mangrove.when_to_pick: Almost always draft if offered. Best in mid-to-late game but worth speculating on early. Even without O2 raise, 1 VP + greenery for 15 MC is solid.

Space Hotels.name: Space Hotels
Space Hotels.economy: 15 MC total (12+3) for 4 MC-prod (~20-24 MC) + Space+Earth tags (~4 MC). Req: 2 Earth tags. Ti payable. 3.75 MC per MC-prod = excellent rate.
Space Hotels.reasoning: Best MC production card per MC/prod ratio. 3.75 MC per production is exceptional. Space+Earth tags add synergy value. Ti payable reduces effective cost. 2 Earth tag requirement is manageable with corps/preludes. benbever shows it is strictly better value than Acquired Company. Must be played gen 1-2 for full value.
Space Hotels.when_to_pick: Gen 1 with 2 Earth tags (or 1 + corp/prelude). Loses value rapidly after gen 2.

Trading Colony.name: Trading Colony
Trading Colony.economy: 18+3=21 MC (ti-payable) for colony placement + effect: +1 colony track step per trade. Colony SP costs 17 MC, so net +4 MC for an incredible ongoing effect (~3 MC/gen). Space tag for discounts.
Trading Colony.reasoning: Combines colony placement (which you'd do anyway) with Trade Envoys effect for only 4 MC more than SP colony. Krazyguy75 says 'the standard project for colonies is already way too cheap, yet this is a major benefit for only 4 more.' Ti-payable Space tag makes it very affordable for engine players.
Trading Colony.when_to_pick: Almost always in Colonies games. Best early when you haven't placed a colony yet. Ti-payable makes it accessible.

Mining Colony.name: Mining Colony
Mining Colony.economy: 20+3=23 MC for colony placement (~8-12 MC value depending on colony) + 1 ti-prod (12.5 MC gen 1) + Space tag (ti-payable). Effective cost with ti = ~17 MC. Net +0 to +5 MC, plus colony income stream.
Mining Colony.reasoning: Colony + ti-prod in one card with a Space tag is excellent package. The colony placement itself can be worth 8-12 MC depending on available colonies (Titan, Ganymede top picks). The ti-prod pays for itself by gen 4-5. Space tag means ti-payable, dropping effective cost significantly. Competes with other colony cards but the ti-prod adds unique value for space engine players.
Mining Colony.when_to_pick: Gen 1-3 with good colonies available and ti-production synergies. Best when Titan or Ganymede colony is open. Skip if colonies are full or you have no space engine.

Venus Orbital Survey.name: Venus Orbital Survey
Venus Orbital Survey.economy: 18+3=21 MC for action: reveal 2 cards, free Venus cards. Ti-payable via Space tag. Venus+Space tags worth 3-5 MC. 1 Venus card free/gen = 3-4 MC/gen average. Break-even gen 4.
Venus Orbital Survey.reasoning: Free Venus cards every generation is a powerful engine for Venus-focused strategies. No requirements means playable anytime. Ti-payable via Space tag reduces effective cost. The action filters the deck for Venus cards which tend to have high value (Stratopolis, Venusian Animals, etc.). Even non-Venus cards can be bought at 3 MC. Works best in longer games where cumulative free cards add up. Venus+Space dual tag has good synergy potential.
Venus Orbital Survey.when_to_pick: When running Venus strategy or Aphrodite/Morning Star. Gen 1-3 for maximum value. Ti-payable makes it accessible for space engine players even without Venus focus.

Mars Nomads.name: Mars Nomads
Mars Nomads.economy: Cost 13+3=16 MC. No tags (penalty -3 to -5). Action: collect placement bonuses (~2-6 MC/use). Over 4-5 uses = 8-30 MC total value. High variance.
Mars Nomads.reasoning: Strong action card that collects placement bonuses repeatedly. In 3P harder to block than 2P but still very good if played early. The no-tag penalty hurts (-3 to -5). FieldMouse007 calls it strong; community consensus is it's great early, weak late. Map-dependent value with Elysium being best.
Mars Nomads.when_to_pick: Early game only. If drawn gen 3+ the value drops significantly. Best on maps with rich placement bonuses (Elysium).

Trade Envoys.name: Trade Envoys
Trade Envoys.economy: 6+3=9 MC for effect: +1 colony track step per trade. Each step ~2-4 MC value. With trading every gen: 2-4 MC-prod equivalent. With 2 trade fleets: doubled. No tags is a penalty (-3 to -5).
Trade Envoys.reasoning: One of the best colony support cards. FieldMouse007 confirms 'strong card, easily generates good value.' SoupsBane calculates ~4 trades to profit. jaminfine calls it 'one of the best economy cards around' comparing to Space Hotels. The no-tag penalty is real but the effect is worth it. Needs energy to trade.
Trade Envoys.when_to_pick: When you can trade regularly. Very high priority if you have 2 trade fleets. Even with 1 fleet, excellent value.

Electro Catapult.name: Electro Catapult
Electro Catapult.economy: 17+3=20 MC + energy-prod loss (~7 MC) = 27 MC effective. Action: sell steel/plant for 7 MC = ~5 MC net per action after opportunity cost. 1 VP = 5 MC. Building tag for steel discount. ~5 MC/gen means break-even gen 5. Max 8% O2 requirement limits window.
Electro Catapult.reasoning: Strong repeatable economy action that converts steel/plants into cash. At ~5 MC net per action it is one of the better repeatable income sources. The Building tag allows steel payment reducing effective cost. 1 VP is nice bonus. The max 8% O2 requirement limits the play window but in 3P/WGT you usually have 3-4 gens at low O2. Energy production cost is the main downside. Pairs excellently with plant/steel production engines.
Electro Catapult.when_to_pick: Gen 1-3 when O2 is below 8% and you have energy production. Best with steel/plant production engine. Building tag makes it steel-payable.

Astra Mechanica.name: Astra Mechanica
Astra Mechanica.economy: 7+3=10 MC for Science tag (3-5 MC) + return 2 events to hand. Value of returned events: 0 to 30+ MC depending on targets. Typical good case: 15-20 MC net.
Astra Mechanica.reasoning: Extremely powerful when you have good event targets in your pile (Giant Ice Asteroid, NRA, Deimos Down, Conscription, Solar Probe). 10 MC for recycling two strong events can generate 20+ MC in value. The Science tag is a bonus. However, you need played events worth replaying, which is not guaranteed. In 3P/WGT the card can be game-winning if timed right. Without good targets it is just an overpriced Science tag.
Astra Mechanica.when_to_pick: After playing 2+ strong events. Keep if you have expensive space events or powerful events in your pile.

Cultural Metropolis.name: Cultural Metropolis
Cultural Metropolis.economy: 20 MC (steel payable) + 3 MC card + ~7 MC energy prod = ~30 MC cost. Returns: 3 MC-prod (~15 MC gen1), 2 delegates (~10 MC), city tile (VP + placement bonus ~4-10 MC), City+Building tags (~3 MC). Total value ~32-38 MC.
Cultural Metropolis.reasoning: One of the best city cards. The 2 delegates in 1 party is very strong — can snipe Chairman for 1 TR and force a ruling bonus. Steel payable, no oxygen requirement, and good tags for milestones. Unity ruling requirement is manageable with 2 delegates. Per benbever, the delegate placement alone can be worth more than 10 MC in the right situation.
Cultural Metropolis.when_to_pick: Early-mid game with steel resources and spare energy production. Great for Mayor milestone and city-based awards.

Ice Moon Colony.name: Ice Moon Colony
Ice Moon Colony.economy: 23 MC + 3 MC card = 26 MC for 1 ocean (SP 18 MC) + 1 colony (SP 17 MC) = 35 MC combined value. Saves 9 MC vs standard projects. Space tag for ti payment.
Ice Moon Colony.reasoning: Excellent value card that combines ocean and colony at a significant discount. The 9 MC savings over standard projects is well above the typical 4 MC card discount. Space tag enables titanium payment. Non-event so you keep the Space tag. Best early when colonies are most valuable and ocean spots are good.
Ice Moon Colony.when_to_pick: Early-mid game when good colony spots and ocean placement bonuses are available. Excellent titanium dump.

Media Group.name: Media Group
Media Group.economy: Cost 6+3=9 MC. Value: Earth tag (2-3) + 3 MC per event played. Breaks even at 3 events. After 5 events = +6 MC profit.
Media Group.reasoning: Excellent rebate card. Events are generally strong cards you want to play anyway, so this adds pure value. Breaks even after just 3 events, which is very achievable. shai_aus calls it great, especially early. ad_hocNC rates it solid B-tier. Earth tag adds synergy with Point Luna, Teractor, etc.
Media Group.when_to_pick: Early game with events in hand. Even mid-game it's good if you expect 3+ more events. High draft priority.

Red Spot Observatory.name: Red Spot Observatory
Red Spot Observatory.economy: 20 MC total (17+3) for 2 VP + 2 cards (~8 MC) + Jovian+Science tags (~8 MC) + card draw action. No Space tag = cannot pay with titanium. Req: 3 Science tags.
Red Spot Observatory.reasoning: Good package deal for science/Jovian engines. 2 VP + 2 cards + dual premium tags for 20 MC is reasonable. The floater action provides card draw every 2 turns, or every turn with external floater sources. No Space tag is a notable downside. benbever gives detailed positive analysis. Solid B-tier science payoff.
Red Spot Observatory.when_to_pick: When building science engine with 3+ tags and Jovian synergies. Better with floater support.

Sub-Crust Measurements.name: Sub-Crust Measurements
Sub-Crust Measurements.economy: 20+3=23 MC (steel-payable) for Action: draw 1 card + 2 VP + Science+Building+Earth tags. With 5 gens of use: 5 cards (15-20 MC) + 2 VP (10 MC). Tags worth ~7 MC.
Sub-Crust Measurements.reasoning: Half an AI Central but with triple tags (Science+Building+Earth), 2 VP, steel-payable, no energy cost. shai_aus calls it 'off-brand AI Central and quite a bit worse' but community notes the easier requirements compensate. Drawing 1 card/gen for 5+ gens is strong engine fuel. Point Luna synergy with Earth tag.
Sub-Crust Measurements.when_to_pick: When you have 2+ science tags and plan an engine game. Steel to dump makes it cheaper. Early-mid game priority.

Birds.name: Birds
Birds.economy: 10+3=13 MC for VP engine (1 VP/animal/gen). In 3P at 13% O2, expect 3-4 gens of animals = 3-4 VP = 15-20 MC. Minus ~2 plant-prod taken from opponent (-5 MC value as take-that). Animal tag worth 2-3 MC for Ecological Zone etc. Net +7-12 MC.
Birds.reasoning: One of the strongest VP engines when it fires. Each generation adds 1 VP (5 MC value), making it extremely efficient over time. However, the 13% O2 requirement means it comes online late -- usually gen 5-6 in 3P/WGT. The -2 plant-prod is take-that which helps a third player, but at 13% O2 plant-prod is less critical. Animal tag enables Ecological Zone, Pets combo. The key risk is the late timing -- fewer generations means fewer animals. With animal placement cards (Imported Hydrogen, Extreme-Cold Fungus) it accelerates significantly.
Birds.when_to_pick: When O2 is approaching 13% and you expect 3+ more gens. Much better with animal placement support. Counter-draft to deny opponents the VP engine.

Ganymede Colony.name: Ganymede Colony
Ganymede Colony.economy: 20 MC (ti payable) + 3 MC card = 23 MC cost. Returns: city tile + 1 VP per Jovian tag. With 4-5 Jovian tags: 4-5 VP (~20-25 MC late) + Space+Jovian tags (~6 MC). Total ~26-31 MC.
Ganymede Colony.reasoning: The premier Jovian VP multiplier card. In a Jovian-focused game with 4-5 tags, this yields 4-5 VP for 23 MC which is excellent. The city on reserved area means guaranteed placement but no adjacency VP. Ti payable via Space tag. Per COTD consensus, it's the capstone card for Jovian strategies. Even with 3 Jovian tags (including itself), 3 VP for 23 MC is acceptable. The city counts for Mayor.
Ganymede Colony.when_to_pick: Late game with 3+ Jovian tags. The more Jovian tags you have, the higher priority.

Ice Asteroid.name: Ice Asteroid
Ice Asteroid.economy: 23 MC + 3 MC card = 26 MC for 2 oceans (2 TR = ~14-15 MC + ~6-8 MC placement bonuses = ~20-23 MC value). Space tag for ti payment. Event tag synergies.
Ice Asteroid.reasoning: Solid space event that places 2 oceans efficiently. With placement bonuses and titanium payment, this is often good value. Great for accelerating game end or grabbing ocean spots. Arctic Algae synergy is excellent. Earth/Space event tags provide discount opportunities. One of the better ocean-placing cards in the game.
Ice Asteroid.when_to_pick: Early-mid game when ocean spots are still good. Excellent titanium dump. Great with Arctic Algae or ocean synergies.

Mass Converter.name: Mass Converter
Mass Converter.economy: Cost 8+3=11 MC. Value: 6 energy-prod (45 MC!) + space discount effect. But 5 Science tags is a very steep requirement. Science+Power tags (~4+1).
Mass Converter.reasoning: Absurdly efficient IF you can meet the 5 Science tag requirement. The cheapest energy source in the game by far. Krazyguy75 says it's undervalued by 24 cost. But the requirement makes it unplayable in many games. In science-heavy engines it's a game-changer. Score reflects requirement difficulty balancing raw power. [ThreadPacifist] 'Always take.' Enables Hi-Tech Lab (draw 6 cards), Physics Complex, and massive colony trading. Strong Science tag for engine. Key engine piece that transforms energy-poor games. Effect-based value (energy production) is permanent and game-changing.
Mass Converter.when_to_pick: When you already have 3+ science tags and plan to play more. Keep in hand speculatively if drawn early with science path.

Mohole Area.name: Mohole Area
Mohole Area.economy: Cost 20+3=23 MC (steel payable). Value: 4 heat-prod (16 MC gen 1, but ~24 in quantified) + tile on ocean space + Building tag. Total ~26-30 MC. Net +3-7.
Mohole Area.reasoning: Best heat production card in the game. 4 heat-prod for 20 MC steel-payable is excellent. The tile on ocean space gives placement bonuses and map control. shai_aus, ad_hocNC, and icehawk84 all rate it highly. Great for Robotic Workforce copy. Enables 1 temperature raise every 2 gens. Must play gen 1-2 for full value.
Mohole Area.when_to_pick: Gen 1-2 as terraforming anchor. Steel payable makes it very efficient. Late game it's too slow.

Quantum Communications.name: Quantum Communications
Quantum Communications.economy: 11 MC total (8+3) for X MC-prod (1 per colony in play) + 1 VP. No tags = -3 to -5 penalty. In 3P with good colonies, typically 5-8 MC-prod mid-game.
Quantum Communications.reasoning: Powerful MC production card when colonies are heavily used. 4 Science tag requirement limits it to mid-late game. No tags is a real penalty. In 3P with Luna/Ceres/Pluto, easily gives 6+ MC-prod for just 11 MC total, which is exceptional value. COTD calls it 'insanely cheap for what it does.'
Quantum Communications.when_to_pick: When you have 3+ science tags and good colonies are in play. Draft early if going science, play when 4 tags met.

Trees.name: Trees
Trees.economy: 13+3=16 MC for 3 plant-prod (24 MC) + 1 plant (2 MC) + 1 VP (5 MC) + Plant tag (~1-2 MC). Req -4C. Total value ~32 MC. Exceptional efficiency if played when unlocked.
Trees.reasoning: icehawk84 says 'very good, not quite as strong as Kelp Farming.' 3 plant-prod for 16 MC is outstanding. The -4C requirement means mid-game play, but 3 plant-prod can generate 2+ greeneries easily. shai_aus confirms it's 'great' especially with NRA/Insects combo. Plant tag is useful for bio milestones.
Trees.when_to_pick: When -4C is achievable soon. Even holding until requirement is met is fine. One of the best plant production cards.

Red Ships.name: Red Ships
Red Ships.economy: 2+3=5 MC total. Action: gain 1 MC per non-Mars global parameter that is not maxed. Early game = ~4-5 MC/action. Total lifetime value ~15-25 MC for 5 MC cost. Net +10-20 MC.
Red Ships.reasoning: Incredibly cheap for the value it provides. At 5 MC total cost, even 2-3 activations make it profitable. In early game with Venus, temperature, oxygen, and oceans all low, the action yields 4-5 MC. As parameters rise the value decreases, creating a natural scaling curve. The 4% O2 requirement is mild. No tags is a small penalty. The main weakness is it becomes worthless as parameters max out, but by then it has already paid for itself many times over. One of the best value-per-MC cards in the game.
Red Ships.when_to_pick: Gen 1-3 when parameters are low. Always pick if offered early -- the ROI is absurd for 5 MC. Becomes unplayable gen 6+.

Atalanta Planitia Lab.name: Atalanta Planitia Lab
Atalanta Planitia Lab.economy: 10+3=13 MC for 2 VP (10 MC) + 2 cards (6-8 MC) + Venus tag (2-3 MC) + Science tag (3-5 MC). Total ~21-26 MC. Excellent value.
Atalanta Planitia Lab.reasoning: Outstanding value card behind a 3 Science tag requirement. 2 VP + 2 cards + dual Science/Venus tags for 13 MC is a fantastic deal. Better than Research (which costs 14 MC for 2 cards + 2 Science tags). The Venus tag helps with Venuphile award and Diversifier. Playable from mid-game onwards since most engine players reach 3 Science tags. One of the best Venus-tagged cards.
Atalanta Planitia Lab.when_to_pick: When you have 2+ Science tags and expect to reach 3. High priority for engine players. Good anytime mid-to-late game.

Big Asteroid.name: Big Asteroid
Big Asteroid.economy: 27+3=30 MC for 2 temp TR (14 MC) + 4 ti (12 MC) + remove 4 plants. Net cost ~15 MC for 2 TR. Ti-payable. Event synergies.
Big Asteroid.reasoning: Strong space event for rushers. After ti cashback, the effective cost is ~15 MC for 2 temperature TR, which is excellent (7.5 MC/TR). Great combo with Deimos Down for massive temperature pushes. Ti-payable, event tag triggers Media Group, IC, Optimal Aerobraking. The 4 plant removal is a nice bonus. One of the better asteroid events.
Big Asteroid.when_to_pick: Most games when rushing temperature. Higher priority with ti discount/event rebates. Good for sniping ocean bonus at -24C.

Field-Capped City.name: Field-Capped City
Field-Capped City.economy: 29 MC (steel payable) + 3 MC card = 32 MC cost. Returns: 2 MC-prod (~10 MC gen1), 1 energy-prod (~7.5 MC), 3 plants (~6 MC), city tile (~10-16 MC), City+Building+Power tags (~5 MC). Total ~38-44 MC.
Field-Capped City.reasoning: One of the best city cards in the game because it GIVES energy production instead of costing it. Per benbever, compared to Cupola (which costs energy), this effectively costs 15 MC for the city component. No requirements means playable any time. 3 tags are excellent for milestones. The 3 plants enable greenery conversion. Steel payable with Building tag. Expensive in absolute terms but very good value per MC.
Field-Capped City.when_to_pick: Early-mid game with steel resources. One of few cities that doesn't hurt your energy economy.

Fish.name: Fish
Fish.economy: 9 MC + 3 MC card = 12 MC cost. Action: +1 animal (1 VP each). -1 plant-prod opponent. Typically 2-3 VP = 10-15 MC value. With animal placers: 4+ VP.
Fish.reasoning: Strong 1-VP-per-animal card, comparable to Birds. The +2°C requirement is often met before 13% oxygen, making Fish sometimes available earlier than Birds. Per icehawk84, Fish is among the best animal cards. The -1 plant-prod attack is a minor bonus in 3P (take-that concerns apply but it's free bonus, not core value). Typically 2-3 VP self-generated, ceiling higher with Large Convoy, Imported Nitrogen etc.
Fish.when_to_pick: When temperature is close to +2°C and you have or expect animal placement cards. Similar priority to Birds.

GMO Contract.name: GMO Contract
GMO Contract.economy: 3 MC + 3 MC card = 6 MC cost. Effect: +2 MC when you play a plant, animal, or microbe tag. Greens ruling req. Science tag (~4 MC). With 4-6 bio tags after: 8-12 MC = great for 6 MC investment.
GMO Contract.reasoning: Excellent value in bio-tag strategies. At 6 MC cost, paying for itself with just 3 bio tags played afterward is easy. Per icehawk84 in Ecology Research COTD, with bio combos this can get completely out of hand. The Greens ruling requirement is manageable — Greens are often in power mid-game when you'd want to play this anyway. The Science tag adds value. A mini Earth Office for bio tags.
GMO Contract.when_to_pick: Gen 1-3 with planned bio-tag strategy and Greens accessible. Excellent return even with 3-4 future bio tags.

Homeostasis Bureau.name: Homeostasis Bureau
Homeostasis Bureau.economy: 16 MC + 3 MC card = 19 MC. 2 heat prod (~8 MC). Effect: gain MC back when spending heat for temp raises. With ~3-4 temp raises via heat = ~9-12 MC back. Building tag payable in steel.
Homeostasis Bureau.reasoning: Strong synergy card for heat-based terraforming. The 2 heat production alone is worth 8 MC, and the MC-back effect on temperature raises can generate significant value over the game. Works especially well when temp raises are abundant and you're actively pushing heat. The effect also works on asteroid-type cards that raise temp. Building tag for steel payment. Good floor, high ceiling.
Homeostasis Bureau.when_to_pick: Early game when planning to terraform via heat. Excellent gen 1-3 play. Loses value if temperature is already near max.

Lunar Exports.name: Lunar Exports
Lunar Exports.economy: 19 MC + 3 MC card = 22 MC for 5 MC-prod (~25 MC) or 2 plant-prod (~16 MC). Earth+Space tags (~4 MC). Ti-payable. MC mode: 4.4 MC/MC-prod = above average.
Lunar Exports.reasoning: Solid production card with excellent flexibility. The MC-prod mode at 4.4 MC per production is above average for gen 1. Earth+Space tags provide synergy value and titanium payment option. The plant mode is almost never correct (just do SP Greenery). No requirements makes it always playable. Great early-game economy card, especially with prelude titanium.
Lunar Exports.when_to_pick: Gen 1-3 for MC production mode. Ti-payable makes it excellent with prelude titanium. Almost always take MC over plants.

Meat Industry.name: Meat Industry
Meat Industry.economy: Cost 5+3=8 MC (steel payable). Value: Building tag (1-2) + 2 MC per animal gained. With 1 animal/gen = Sponsors equivalent. With 2+/gen = absurd value.
Meat Industry.reasoning: Cheap enabler that scales from mediocre to broken. With Ecological Zone, Martian Zoo, Pets, or Miranda colony, it generates massive MC. Floor is low (need animal cards), but ceiling is extraordinary. Krazyguy75 notes it's 'never fine -- always either too strong or too weak.' Draft it when you have animal synergy. [BonelessDota] S-tier in GODMODE engine. 'Can completely get out of control' with green tags generating animals. Each animal gained = 2 MC, compounding with Ecological Zone, Birds, Fish, Miranda colony.
Meat Industry.when_to_pick: When you have 1+ VP animal cards or Ecological Zone. With Miranda colony in play it becomes very strong. Don't draft without animal synergy.

Mining Area.name: Mining Area
Mining Area.economy: Cost 4+3=7 MC (steel payable). Value: 1 steel/ti-prod (8-12.5) + placement bonus (2-3) + Building tag (1-2). Total ~11-17 MC. Net +4-10 MC.
Mining Area.reasoning: One of the best production cards when placement is available. Requires a tile next to your own on a mineral spot, which limits early-game use. On titanium it's phenomenal (12.5 MC value for 7 MC cost). shai_aus rates it S-tier for Mining Guild. The tile placement is bonus value for milestones/awards.
Mining Area.when_to_pick: When you have a tile adjacent to a mineral spot. Prioritize titanium over steel. Keep in opening hand.

Robotic Workforce.name: Robotic Workforce
Robotic Workforce.economy: 12 MC total (9+3) for duplicating a building card's production box. Science tag worth ~3-5 MC. Value depends entirely on target card. Best targets: Mohole Area (4 heat prod), Fusion Power (3 energy), Medical Lab, Tectonic Stress Power.
Robotic Workforce.reasoning: Excellent when you have a strong building production card to copy. Science tag is very valuable. benbever lists many great targets. The card is never bad as a 12 MC science tag, and can be game-changing when copying Mohole Area or similar. shai_aus notes it copies ALL production including costs.
Robotic Workforce.when_to_pick: Draft when you have good building cards with production boxes. Play after the target card is played.

Sulphur-Eating Bacteria.name: Sulphur-Eating Bacteria
Sulphur-Eating Bacteria.economy: 6+3=9 MC for ~3 MC equivalent production per gen (action: add microbe or cash out at 3 MC each). Venus+Microbe tags worth ~3-4 MC. With Enceladus colony: explosive income potential.
Sulphur-Eating Bacteria.reasoning: Effectively 3 MC-prod for 9 MC is excellent. icehawk84 says it can net 30-40 MC. FieldMouse007 notes it's much worse than real income because you must wait before cashing out. Enceladus colony makes this card broken. Venus 6% requirement limits early play but is usually achievable by gen 2-3 with WGT.
Sulphur-Eating Bacteria.when_to_pick: Almost always when Venus 6% is met or close. Especially strong with Enceladus colony. Draft early, play when requirement is met.

Topsoil Contract.name: Topsoil Contract
Topsoil Contract.economy: 8+3=11 MC for 3 plants (6 MC) + effect: gain 1 MC per microbe added anywhere + Microbe+Earth tags (~4 MC). Base value 10 MC. With 2+ microbe actions/gen: 2+ MC-prod equivalent.
Topsoil Contract.reasoning: Excellent combo card. shai_aus gives high draft priority. The 3 plants + Earth tag already justify most of the cost. The microbe rebate effect can generate 10-40+ MC over a game with the right engine. icehawk84 says 'not very strong but 3 instant plants and a bio tag for 11 MC is not bad with synergies.' Strong with Enceladus.
Topsoil Contract.when_to_pick: Almost always when you have or plan to have microbe generation. Even without, 3 plants + Earth tag is decent.

Open City.name: Open City
Open City.economy: 23+3=26 MC - energy-prod (~7 MC) = 33 MC effective. City tile adjacency (2-4 MC from greeneries) + 4 MC-prod (20-24 MC gen 1-3) + 2 plants (1.6 MC) + 1 VP (5 MC). City+Building tags for steel. Total value ~30-35 MC. Net -3 to +2 MC but with city tile value.
Open City.reasoning: The best base-game city card. 4 MC-prod is the highest on any city card and the Building tag means steel-payable. The 12% O2 requirement means it comes gen 4-6 in 3P/WGT. 2 plants helps toward greenery. City placement near own greeneries adds adjacency VP. The energy-prod cost is standard for cities. Steel-payable via Building+City tags significantly reduces effective cost. Late-game timing is the main drawback -- the MC-prod has fewer gens to pay off.
Open City.when_to_pick: Gen 4-6 when O2 approaches 12% and you have energy-prod and steel. Best city in base game for pure economy. Steel dump priority.

Sponsoring Nation.name: Sponsoring Nation
Sponsoring Nation.economy: 21+3=24 MC for 3 TR (21-22.2 MC) + 2 delegates (6-8 MC Turmoil value) + Earth tag (2-3 MC). Total value ~30-33 MC. Net +6-9 MC. Requires 4 Earth tags which is achievable but not trivial.
Sponsoring Nation.reasoning: 3 TR is massive value equivalent to ~21 MC. The 2 delegates on top provide party control which is worth 3-4 MC each in Turmoil games. Earth tag adds to count for future cards. The 4 Earth tag requirement is the main gate -- you need significant Earth investment, but with Point Luna, Teractor, or Earth Office this is very achievable. In 3P/WGT Turmoil games, this card is a powerhouse for Earth-focused players. Without Turmoil it loses the delegate value and drops to C-tier.
Sponsoring Nation.when_to_pick: Mid-game (gen 3-5) when you have 3+ Earth tags and Turmoil is active. Top priority for Earth engine players. Skip without Turmoil or insufficient Earth tags.

Algae.name: Algae
Algae.economy: 10+3=13 MC for 2 plant-prod (16 MC gen 1) + 1 plant (2 MC) + Plant tag (1-2 MC). Total ~19 MC. Excellent value at 5.5 MC/plant-prod.
Algae.reasoning: One of the best plant production cards. 2 plant-prod + 1 plant for only 13 MC is great value. The 5 ocean requirement is achievable gen 2-4 in 3P with preludes (ocean preludes are common). Plant tag enables NRA, Insects, Ecologist. The main risk is oceans being slow, making the card dead in hand. In 3P/WGT oceans usually come out reasonably fast.
Algae.when_to_pick: When 5 oceans will be met gen 2-4 and you want greeneries. Speculate early if ocean preludes are played.

Energy Market.name: Energy Market
Energy Market.economy: 3 MC + 3 MC card = 6 MC cost. Action: sell energy-prod for 8 MC or buy energy for 2 MC each. Power tag (~1 MC). With 3 excess energy-prod sold: 24 MC over last 3 gens.
Energy Market.reasoning: Extremely cheap card with surprisingly strong flexibility. Per FieldMouse007, the sell-energy-production action is the real strength — turning excess production into 8 MC per gen in the endgame is very efficient. Per benbever, enables great combos with Space Mirrors and Fusion Power. With Colonies, buying energy to trade is valuable. The Power tag is rare and occasionally needed. A classic 'underrated cheap action card.'
Energy Market.when_to_pick: Almost always worth picking up for 6 MC total cost. Especially good with Colonies or energy-heavy engines.

Frontier Town.name: Frontier Town
Frontier Town.economy: 11 MC (steel payable) + 3 MC card + ~7 MC energy prod = ~21 MC cost. Returns: city tile + 3x PRINTED placement bonus. Typical bonus ~12 MC (triple 2 plants or 2 steel). City+Building tags.
Frontier Town.reasoning: Incredible ceiling depending on map spot. Per benbever's exhaustive analysis, some maps have crazy spots — Elysium 9 plants (instant greenery), Terra Cimmeria 3 colonies for 15 MC, Vastitas 3 temperature raises. The Mars First requirement is manageable with 2 delegates. Average case: triple a 2-plant spot = 6 plants + city, which is strong. Below average case: 21 MC for a city + 6 MC bonus, which is fine.
Frontier Town.when_to_pick: Gen 1-3 with a strong printed placement bonus spot available. Check map before drafting.

Interplanetary Colony Ship.name: Interplanetary Colony Ship
Interplanetary Colony Ship.economy: 12 MC + 3 MC card = 15 MC for 1 colony (SP 17 MC). Saves 2 MC minimum. Earth+Space event tags enable discounts. Ti-payable. With discounts: can be nearly free.
Interplanetary Colony Ship.reasoning: Solid colony placement at a discount. Even without synergies it's 2 MC cheaper than standard project. Earth+Space event tags open up massive discount possibilities. Titanium payable. In Colonies format, colony placement is very valuable early game. One of several efficient colony cards that make the expansion strong.
Interplanetary Colony Ship.when_to_pick: Early-mid game when colony spots are still valuable. Great with event/space discounts. Standard titanium dump.

Interstellar Colony Ship.name: Interstellar Colony Ship
Interstellar Colony Ship.economy: 24 MC + 3 MC card = 27 MC base. 4 VP. Requires 5 Science tags. At base price: 6.75 MC/VP = ok. With titanium + discounts: can drop to 10-15 MC effective = excellent.
Interstellar Colony Ship.reasoning: Heavily overpriced at face value but designed to be played with massive discounts. Science engine players typically have Earth Office, space discounts, and leftover titanium by late game. The 4 VP is the highest single-card VP without card draw. The 5 Science requirement is the main barrier but usually met by science engine players. Good last-gen titanium dump.
Interstellar Colony Ship.when_to_pick: When playing science engine and have 4+ Science tags. Hold for last gen titanium dump with discounts. Don't play at full price.

Martian Media Center.name: Martian Media Center
Martian Media Center.economy: Cost 7+3=10 MC (steel payable). Value: 2 MC-prod (10-12) + action saves 2 MC/gen on delegates. Building tag (1-2). Over 4 gens, action saves 8 MC.
Martian Media Center.reasoning: Excellent value when Mars First is accessible. The 2 MC-prod alone nearly pays for the card, and the cheap delegate action (3 MC instead of 5) adds up significantly. Building tag is good. The party requirement is manageable in 3P since Mars First is popular. benbever rates it highly.
Martian Media Center.when_to_pick: When Mars First is ruling or you have 2 delegates there. Best early game for maximum production value.

Stratospheric Birds.name: Stratospheric Birds
Stratospheric Birds.economy: 12+3=15 MC + 1 floater cost for 1 VP/animal action. Venus+Animal tags worth ~3-4 MC. 3 gens remaining = 3 VP (15 MC value). With animal placers: 5+ VP ceiling.
Stratospheric Birds.reasoning: Strong 1-VP-per-animal card but held back by dual requirements: 12% Venus AND spending a floater. In all-expansions play, Venus often stays low making this unplayable. When it works, it's very strong - comparable to Birds. Venus+Animal dual tag is great for Ecologist and Freyja Biodomes.
Stratospheric Birds.when_to_pick: When Venus is at/near 12% and you have a floater to spend. High priority if requirements are met, skip if Venus is ignored.

Terraforming Contract.name: Terraforming Contract
Terraforming Contract.economy: 8+3=11 MC for 4 MC-prod (20-24 MC) + Earth tag (~2-3 MC). 2.75 MC/prod is excellent. Req TR 25 (hard with Turmoil but doable gen 1-2 with preludes).
Terraforming Contract.reasoning: One of the best MC production efficiency cards in the game. ad_hocNC confirms 'quite good' and notes preludes make the requirement easy. icehawk84 says 'can be playable even mid-game.' The Earth tag adds Point Luna/Teractor synergy. Turmoil makes TR 25 harder but still achievable.
Terraforming Contract.when_to_pick: Gen 1-3 when TR 25 is achievable. With terraforming preludes it's nearly free to meet. Even gen 4-5 if not too late.

Warp Drive.name: Warp Drive
Warp Drive.economy: 14+3=17 MC for effect: -2 MC on Space tag cards + 2 VP (10 MC) + Science tag (~3-5 MC). Req 5 Science tags. Effective discount cost: 17-10-4 = 3 MC for the discount. Need 2 space cards to break even.
Warp Drive.reasoning: Krazyguy75 says 'no brainer if you have the requirement, don't pick if you don't.' 5 Science tags is steep but science engines naturally accumulate them. shai_aus prefers Mass Converter but this is still strong. 2 VP is excellent. Late-gen space card dumps (Interstellar Colony Ship, Large Convoy) benefit greatly.
Warp Drive.when_to_pick: When you have 4+ science tags. Auto-play. The 2 VP + discount pays immediately with any space card.

Asteroid Rights.name: Asteroid Rights
Asteroid Rights.economy: 10+3=13 MC for Earth tag (2-3 MC) + Space tag (1-2 MC) + 2 asteroids (6 MC ti) immediate. Action: spend 1 MC = gain 1 ti or spend asteroids for MC-prod. Fast payoff.
Asteroid Rights.reasoning: Excellent fast-payoff economy card. The 2 immediate asteroids give 6 MC in ti, and the action provides flexible conversion between MC-prod and ti production. Pays for itself in ~2 gens even without synergy. Earth + Space dual tag adds value. The main weakness is that the individual actions are small -- each conversion is only ~3 MC of value. But the efficiency is very high for the cost.
Asteroid Rights.when_to_pick: Gen 1-5 when you have space card targets for titanium. Good fast economy even without asteroid synergy.

Carbon Nanosystems.name: Carbon Nanosystems
Carbon Nanosystems.economy: 14+3=17 MC (steel-payable) for Science+Building tags (4-7 MC) + 1 VP (5 MC) + 1 graphene immediately. Each future Science tag = 4 MC for space/city cards. 3+ more science tags = breakeven.
Carbon Nanosystems.reasoning: Strong science engine card that generates 4 MC graphene per science tag played. Steel-payable makes the upfront cost easier. No requirements. With 4+ science tags after playing this, you accumulate 16+ MC to spend on space/city cards. The Science + Building dual tag is valuable. Compared to Earth Catapult/AGT it is less powerful but much easier to play. Good for science players who will play multiple science tags.
Carbon Nanosystems.when_to_pick: Gen 1-4 when building science engine and expect 3+ more science tags. Steel-payable is a big plus.

Caretaker Contract.name: Caretaker Contract
Caretaker Contract.economy: 3+3=6 MC for action: spend 8 heat -> 1 TR (7 MC). Requires 0C. At 1 heat = ~0.5 MC, 8 heat = 4 MC for 7 MC TR. Net ~3 MC/action. No tags = -3 penalty.
Caretaker Contract.reasoning: Strong conversion action that turns heat into TR at a favorable rate. 8 heat for 1 TR is essentially 4 MC for 7 MC. The 0C requirement means mid-to-late game (gen 4-6 typically). The no-tag penalty is offset by the extremely low play cost (6 MC) and strong ongoing action. Every heat-producing player wants this card. Also functions as a stalling action. With Helion it is exceptional.
Caretaker Contract.when_to_pick: When you have 8+ heat production per gen and 0C is close. Essential for heat strategies. Low draft cost.

Comet.name: Comet
Comet.economy: 21+3=24 MC for 1 temp TR (7 MC) + 1 ocean TR (7 MC) + placement bonus (~2-4 MC) + 3 plant removal. Net cost ~7-10 MC for 2 TR. Ti-payable.
Comet.reasoning: Good dual-terraforming event. 2 TR + ocean placement for 24 MC is decent value, especially with ti payment. Less impactful than Deimos Down or Giant Ice Asteroid but cheaper and easier to time. Plant removal is a nice bonus. Excellent with Optimal Aerobraking (+3 heat, +3 MC) and Arctic Algae (+2 plants from ocean). A solid, reliable space event for terraform-focused strategies.
Comet.when_to_pick: Most games when terraforming. Higher priority with space/event discounts. Good for controlling game pace.

Decomposers.name: Decomposers
Decomposers.economy: 5 MC + 3 MC card = 8 MC cost. Counts own tag. With 6-9 bio tags played after: 2-3 VP = 10-15 MC value. With Enceladus or microbe placers: 3-4+ VP.
Decomposers.reasoning: Cheap VP accumulator that scales with bio tags. At 8 MC for typically 2-3 VP, it's efficient. The Microbe tag itself counts, so you start at 1/3 already. Great with Ecological Zone, Viral Enhancers, and colony Enceladus. Per community consensus, regularly worth 2-3 VP in 3P which is solid for the investment.
Decomposers.when_to_pick: Early-mid game when planning bio tag strategy. Great if you already have or expect 4+ bio tags.

Ecology Research.name: Ecology Research
Ecology Research.economy: 21 MC + 3 MC card = 24 MC cost. Returns: X plant-prod (X = colonies owned, usually 1-2 = 8-16 MC gen1), 1 animal (~5 MC), 2 microbes (~3 MC), 1 VP, 4 tags (Science+Plant+Animal+Microbe = ~10 MC). Total ~26-34 MC.
Ecology Research.reasoning: Quad-tag monster with strong bio synergy potential. Per icehawk84, with bio combos this can be a huge 5+ point bomb. The 4 unique tags can steal Diversifier and enable Ecologist. Per community, the plant production scales with colonies. The animal and microbe placement adds value with the right targets. Slightly overpriced without colonies but the tags alone are nearly worth the cost.
Ecology Research.when_to_pick: Mid game with 1-2 colonies and bio-tag targets for the animal and microbes. Excellent for Diversifier snipes.

Event Analysts.name: Event Analysts
Event Analysts.economy: 5 MC + 3 MC card = 8 MC cost. Returns: +1 influence permanent (~2-3 MC per gen) + Science tag (~4 MC). Pays for itself in ~2-3 gens. Scientists ruling requirement manageable.
Event Analysts.reasoning: Great value for Turmoil games. Permanent +1 influence protects against negative global events and boosts positive ones. Per benbever, cheap science tag plus 1 influence is good value for money. Per community, it's a no-brainer to play early-mid game. The Scientists requirement adds some friction but placing 2 delegates in Scientists is often worth it anyway for the policy.
Event Analysts.when_to_pick: Gen 1-5 in Turmoil games. The earlier the better for compound value from influence.

Harvest.name: Harvest
Harvest.economy: 4 MC + 3 MC card cost = 7 MC. Gain 12 MC = net +5 MC profit. Requirement: 3 greeneries, typically met by gen 5-7. Plant tag adds ~2 MC value. Event tag for Legend/Media Group.
Harvest.reasoning: Essentially free money with a Plant tag once requirement is met. Low priority in draft but almost always playable by end of game. The +5 MC net is modest but the Plant tag and event synergies push it up. Great as a free draw.
Harvest.when_to_pick: Always keep if drawn free. Draft if playing plant strategy or need event count. Don't prioritize over key engine pieces.

Imported Nutrients.name: Imported Nutrients
Imported Nutrients.economy: 14 MC + 3 MC card = 17 MC for 4 plants (~8 MC) + 4 microbes (1-2 VP = 5-10 MC on good targets). Earth+Space event = heavy discounts. Ti-payable.
Imported Nutrients.reasoning: Solid Earth+Space event with good value when you have a microbe target. 4 plants for instant greenery conversion is strong. The triple-tag (Earth, Space, Event) opens massive discount possibilities. With Ants or Venusian Insects the microbes are worth 2 VP. Even without microbe target, the plants + discounts can make this worthwhile.
Imported Nutrients.when_to_pick: When you have a good microbe target or heavy discount infrastructure. Great titanium dump. Solid mid-late game play.

Kaguya Tech.name: Kaguya Tech
Kaguya Tech.economy: 10 MC + 3 MC card = 13 MC for 2 MC-prod (~10 MC) + 1 card (~3 MC) + convert greenery to city (net VP depends on position: typically 1-3 VP swing). City+Plant tags.
Kaguya Tech.reasoning: Unique and fun card that converts one of your greeneries into a city. The MC production and card draw add base value, while the greenery-to-city conversion can create devastating VP swings in tight games (stealing adjacency points from opponents). City+Plant tags are unusual and valuable. Requires having a greenery in play. Best played late for surprise point flips.
Kaguya Tech.when_to_pick: When you have greeneries in play and can create a VP swing with city placement. Great surprise last-gen play.

Livestock.name: Livestock
Livestock.economy: 13 MC + 3 MC card = 16 MC. 9% oxygen req. -1 plant prod + 2 MC-prod. Action: +1 animal. 1 VP/animal. Self-scores 3-4 VP. With animal placers: 5-8+ VP.
Livestock.reasoning: Solid 1VP-per-animal card comparable to Birds and Fish. The -1 plant prod self-attack is a downside vs Birds' opponent plant prod attack, but 2 MC-prod partially compensates. Playable slightly earlier than Birds (9% vs 13%). The key value is as an animal placement target for Large Convoy, Imported Nitrogen, Miranda colony. One of only 4 base game 1VP animals.
Livestock.when_to_pick: Mid-late game when you need a 1VP animal target. Slightly weaker than Birds/Fish but still strong. Keep if you have animal placement cards.

Lunar Mining.name: Lunar Mining
Lunar Mining.economy: 11 MC + 3 MC card = 14 MC for 1 ti-prod per 2 Earth tags. With 4 Earth tags (incl this): 2 ti-prod (~25 MC). With 6+: 3 ti-prod (~37.5 MC). Earth tag.
Lunar Mining.reasoning: Extremely powerful with Earth tag density but weak without it. At 2+ ti-prod it's excellent value. Point Luna or Teractor can easily hit 3+ ti-prod. The Earth tag itself counts, making it slightly self-enabling. Can become a game-defining engine piece for Earth-heavy strategies. Important hate-draft target - don't pass to the Earth tag player.
Lunar Mining.when_to_pick: When you have 3+ Earth tags (including this). Hate-draft from Earth tag players. Excellent Point Luna/Teractor piece.

Mercurian Alloys.name: Mercurian Alloys
Mercurian Alloys.economy: Cost 3+3=6 MC (ti payable). Value: Space tag (1-2) + titanium worth +1 each. With 6 titanium used = 6 MC extra value. With 12+ titanium = 12+ MC.
Mercurian Alloys.reasoning: Extremely cheap for a powerful ongoing effect. 2 Science tags is a manageable requirement. Makes every titanium resource worth 25% more. Scales beautifully with Phobolog, titanium production, and ti-heavy strategies. benbever provides detailed analysis showing excellent synergies with ti-production preludes.
Mercurian Alloys.when_to_pick: When you have 2+ science tags and titanium production/resources. Cheap space tag for milestones too.

Penguins.name: Penguins
Penguins.economy: Cost 7+3=10 MC. Value: 1 VP/animal. At 3 animals = 3 VP (15 MC). At 5 = 5 VP (25 MC). Req: 8 oceans. Animal tag (1-2).
Penguins.reasoning: Cheapest 1VP animal card with a manageable requirement (8 oceans, usually met gen 5-7 in 3P). Self-generates 3-4 VP over typical game. With animal placement (Large Convoy, Imported Nitrogen) ceiling is higher. shai_aus rates it probably the best 1VP animal for Inventrix. Follows the 1VP-per-animal = B-tier calibration. [BonelessDota] 'Probably the best animal card' for Ecology Experts combo. Prelude timing advantage over Fish (available earlier in the draft cycle). Consistent VP generator with low requirement.
Penguins.when_to_pick: Mid-game when 8 oceans are close. Good animal dump target. With Inventrix playable much earlier.

Predators.name: Predators
Predators.economy: 17 MC total (14+3) for ~5 VP average when played. 11% oxygen = mid-late game. Eats opponent animals for 2-point swings per action.
Predators.reasoning: High ceiling VP card that averages around 5 VP when played according to icehawk84. The threat of Predators suppresses opponent animal play, which has meta value. 11% oxygen requirement limits timing. In 3P, eating one opponent's animals benefits the third. Still strong as a VP generator and deterrent.
Predators.when_to_pick: Draft early to suppress opponent animal play. Play when 11% oxygen is close and opponents have unprotected animals.

Research Coordination.name: Research Coordination
Research Coordination.economy: 7 MC total (4+3) for a Wild tag. Wild tag is worth ~3-5 MC per use. Enables milestone claims, card requirements, tag-counting effects.
Research Coordination.reasoning: The Wild tag is the most versatile tag in the game. 7 MC for essentially any tag you need is strong. shai_aus gives it high praise. Particularly valuable for milestones (Builder, Ecologist, Diversifier) and unlocking science-gated cards. Does not count for awards (end of game). Krazyguy75 calls it 'solid B tier.'
Research Coordination.when_to_pick: Early game when the wild tag can unlock multiple plays throughout the game. Less valuable late.

Restricted Area.name: Restricted Area
Restricted Area.economy: 14 MC total (11+3) for tile placement (~4 MC) + Science tag (~3 MC) + Action: 2 MC -> 1 card (~2 MC profit/use). Need ~5 uses to break even on action cost.
Restricted Area.reasoning: Good engine card for card draw. Science tag without requirements is valuable. Tile placement provides board presence and bonuses. 2 MC/card draw is reasonable rate. icehawk84 notes 5 uses needed to break even. FieldMouse007 is less enthusiastic, calling it 'mediocre,' but ad_hocNC says it is 'one of the best blue card draw cards.' Best for engine strategies.
Restricted Area.when_to_pick: Early-mid game for engine builders. The tile placement gives immediate value, card draw compounds over time.

Standard Technology.name: Standard Technology
Standard Technology.economy: 6+3=9 MC for Science tag + 1 VP (5 MC) + 3 MC rebate per SP. Net cost ~4 MC for the effect. With 3+ SPs the effect generates 9+ MC. Credicor combo: greenery for 16 MC.
Standard Technology.reasoning: Strong with Credicor ('Creditech' archetype), enabling cheap greeneries and cities. icehawk84 notes the science tag is often more relevant than the effect. Solid in any game where you plan to do standard projects, which is most games. Science tag has high value for requirements. [BonelessDota] 'Maybe the best card for Colonies.' Colony SP = 14 MC (saves 3 MC), Greenery SP = 20 MC (saves 3 MC), City SP = 22 MC (saves 3 MC). Huge with Poseidon corporation. Consistent value that scales with standard project usage.
Standard Technology.when_to_pick: When planning to do 3+ standard projects, especially with Credicor. Science tag always useful. Good early-mid game.

Venusian Animals.name: Venusian Animals
Venusian Animals.economy: 15+3=18 MC for 1 VP per science tag played after. Venus+Animal+Science triple tag (~7-8 MC). Req Venus 18%. If 3 science tags after: 3 VP (15 MC) + tags. If 5+: amazing.
Venusian Animals.reasoning: icehawk84 scored 13 VP on it in one game, calling it one of the best cards when Venus is terraformed early. But Venus 18% is harsh - Krazyguy75 says it takes 6+ gens. The triple tag is excellent. When it works, it's S-tier. Average case: 3-4 VP + great tags. Held back by Venus req unreliability.
Venusian Animals.when_to_pick: When Venus is at/near 18% and you have card draw + science tags to play. Hate-draft against science players if Venus is high.

WG Project.name: WG Project
WG Project.economy: 9+3=12 MC for best-of-3 preludes. Average prelude value ~25 MC, best-of-3 ~28 MC. Net gain ~16 MC. Earth tag worth ~2-3 MC. Req Chairman (may cost 5-10 MC in delegates to secure).
WG Project.reasoning: Play a prelude mid-game for 12 MC is strong. benbever details the math: best-of-3 makes it much less risky than Board of Directors. SoupsBane says 'probably too cheap for its effect.' Some preludes (Loan, UNMI Contractor, Excentric Sponsor) are amazing mid-game. Chairman requirement adds ~5-10 MC cost but being Chairman is already valuable. Earth tag synergizes well.
WG Project.when_to_pick: When you are or can become Chairman. Gen 2-4 for maximum prelude value. Earth tag bonus. Fun and powerful.

Atmoscoop.name: Atmoscoop
Atmoscoop.economy: 22+3=25 MC for 2 TR (14-14.8 MC) + 2 floaters (2-4 MC) + 1 VP (5 MC) + Jovian+Space tags (3-5 MC). Ti-payable. Effective cost with ti ~19-21 MC. Total value ~24-29 MC. Requires 3 Science tags.
Atmoscoop.reasoning: Solid package of 2 TR + floaters + VP with premium Jovian+Space tags. Ti-payable via Space tag. The choice between temperature or Venus gives flexibility -- Venus is usually better for VP strategies. 2 floaters to any card fuels floater engines. The 3 Science tag requirement is the main barrier. Comparable to other 2-TR cards but the tag quality and flexibility make it above average. Jovian tag enables milestone/award.
Atmoscoop.when_to_pick: When you have 3+ Science tags and need TR + tags. Best gen 3-5. Ti-payable makes it Space engine friendly. Venus raise option preferred for floater strategies.

Colonial Representation.name: Colonial Representation
Colonial Representation.economy: 10+3=13 MC for +1 influence permanent (3-5 MC/gen in Turmoil) + 3 MC per colony on play (6-12 MC if 2-4 colonies). Total value ~15-25 MC depending on colonies and remaining gens. No tags (-3 to -5 MC penalty).
Colonial Representation.reasoning: The permanent +1 influence is very strong in Turmoil games -- it affects party bonuses, chairman elections, and delegate effectiveness every generation. The colony rebate on play (3 MC per colony) provides immediate return. With 2-3 colonies this is 6-9 MC back immediately, making effective cost only 4-7 MC for permanent influence. No tags hurts but the Turmoil value compensates. Requires both Colonies and Turmoil expansions to function.
Colonial Representation.when_to_pick: Gen 2-4 with 2+ colonies in Turmoil games. The earlier the permanent influence, the more value. Skip without Turmoil. Best with colony-heavy corps like Poseidon.

Hermetic Order of Mars.name: Hermetic Order of Mars
Hermetic Order of Mars.economy: 10+3=13 MC for 2 MC-prod (10-12 MC gen 1) + MC per empty adjacent area (~3-6 MC immediate). No tags penalty (-3 to -5 MC). Max 4% O2 req limits to gen 1-2. Total value ~13-18 MC. Net +0 to +5 MC.
Hermetic Order of Mars.reasoning: Strong early-game economy card. 2 MC-prod for 13 MC is decent rate (6.5 MC/prod), and the immediate MC from empty adjacent areas can add 3-6 MC. The max 4% O2 requirement forces gen 1-2 play which is actually ideal for MC-prod cards -- maximum gens to compound. No tags is the main penalty. The empty area bonus works best when you have tiles placed early in strategic locations. Comparable to Building Industries but without the useful Building tag.
Hermetic Order of Mars.when_to_pick: Gen 1 only when O2 is at 0-4%. Best with early tile placement for adjacency MC. Always skip after gen 2 -- the window is too narrow.

Stratospheric Expedition.name: Stratospheric Expedition
Stratospheric Expedition.economy: 12+3=15 MC for 2 floaters (2-4 MC) + 2 Venus cards drawn free (6-8 MC value) + 1 VP (5 MC) + Venus+Space tags (3-5 MC). Ti-payable. Total value ~16-22 MC. Net +1 to +7 MC.
Stratospheric Expedition.reasoning: Triple tag (Venus+Space+Event) with floater placement, free Venus card draw, and VP. The 2 free Venus cards are the standout -- equivalent to saving 6 MC on card buy. Ti-payable via Space tag. The floaters fuel engines like Dirigibles, Stratospheric Birds. Venus+Space tags trigger many synergies. Event tag means no lingering tags but the immediate value is strong. Great for Venus-focused strategies where the free cards find high-value Venus targets.
Stratospheric Expedition.when_to_pick: When running Venus strategy or need Venus cards. Ti-payable makes it accessible. Best gen 2-5 for maximum Venus card utilization.

Static Harvesting.name: Static Harvesting
Static Harvesting.economy: 5+3=8 MC for 1 energy-prod (7 MC gen 1) + 1 MC per Building tag (~3-6 MC with 3-6 Building tags). Power tag worth 2-3 MC. Max 3 oceans req. Total value ~12-16 MC. Net +4 to +8 MC.
Static Harvesting.reasoning: Cheap card with scaling immediate payoff. Energy production for 8 MC is slightly above average but the MC-per-Building-tag bonus makes it very efficient for Building-heavy players. With 4-5 Building tags it is effectively free energy-prod with 4-5 MC profit. The max 3 oceans requirement limits it to gen 1-3 typically, which is when energy-prod is most valuable. Power tag is useful for milestone/Thermalist synergies. One of the best cheap Power cards.
Static Harvesting.when_to_pick: Gen 1-2 with 3+ Building tags played or planned. Skip after 3 oceans are placed. Best value with steel-heavy Building strategies.

Virus.name: Virus
Virus.economy: 1+3=4 MC for removing up to 2 animals or 5 plants from any player. In 3P: removing 2 animals = denying ~10 VP = huge swing. 5 plants = denying 1 greenery (~7-9 MC). Microbe tag worth 2-3 MC. Total attack value ~7-15 MC for 4 MC cost.
Virus.reasoning: One of the most efficient attack cards at 4 MC total. Removing 2 animals from Birds/Fish/Predators denies ~10 VP which is game-changing in close games. The 5-plant removal can deny a greenery. Microbe tag is useful for Decomposers, Viral Enhancers. However, take-that in 3P always helps the third player, which is the inherent penalty. The flexibility between animals and plants makes it better than most attack cards. In practice, the animal removal is the killer mode -- save it for end-game VP denial.
Virus.when_to_pick: Draft when opponent has animal VP engine (Birds, Fish, Predators). Even without targets, cheap Microbe tag has value. Best held for late-game animal denial.

Asteroid.name: Asteroid
Asteroid.economy: 14+3=17 MC for 1 temp TR (7 MC) + 2 ti (6 MC) + remove 3 plants. Net cost ~8 MC for 1 TR. Ti-payable via Space tag. Event tag synergies.
Asteroid.reasoning: Solid space event. Effective cost after ti cashback is only ~8 MC for 1 temp TR, which is excellent. Ti-payable, event tag enables Media Group, IC, Optimal Aerobraking synergies. Plant removal is a bonus (not core value). Always a reasonable draft pick for terraform-focused strategies. Not flashy but consistently good.
Asteroid.when_to_pick: Most games when you have titanium. Higher priority with event/space rebates. Good for controlling temperature track.

Flooding.name: Flooding
Flooding.economy: 7 MC + 3 MC card = 10 MC cost. Returns: 1 ocean (1 TR ~7.2 MC + placement bonus ~2-4 MC) + optional -4 MC to opponent. Total ~9-11 MC value + attack bonus. No tags = -3 to -5 penalty.
Flooding.reasoning: Cheapest unrestricted ocean in the game. Per shai_aus, the -1 VP sucks but is cancelled by the TR. The -4 MC attack is a nice bonus but you'd play it without it. Per icehawk84, one of the better ocean events. At 10 MC for an ocean, it's 8 MC cheaper than SP ocean. The no-tag penalty is offset by the raw efficiency. Great for accelerating the game or enabling plant conversions.
Flooding.when_to_pick: Almost always when you need oceans. Good early for placement bonuses, good late for ending the game.

Gene Repair.name: Gene Repair
Gene Repair.economy: 12 MC + 3 MC card = 15 MC cost. Returns: 2 MC-prod (~10 MC gen1) + 2 VP (~10 MC late) + Science tag (~4 MC). Total ~24 MC. Requires 3 Science tags.
Gene Repair.reasoning: Efficient production + VP bundle for science engines. Per the game's formula, 3 Science tag discount makes this effectively cheaper. At 15 MC for 2 MC-prod + 2 VP + Science tag, it's solid value. The 3 Science tag requirement is easily met by mid-game in science engines. Late-game play still yields 2 VP for 15 MC minus whatever MC-prod returns. A reliable mid-game play for engine builders.
Gene Repair.when_to_pick: Gen 3-6 with 3+ science tags. Good bundle of economy and VP for science players.

Luna Metropolis.name: Luna Metropolis
Luna Metropolis.economy: 21 MC + 3 MC card = 24 MC for N MC-prod (per Earth tag including this) + city on reserved area + 2 VP. With 4 Earth tags: 4 MC-prod (~20 MC) + city (~2 VP) + 2 VP. Ti-payable. City+Space+Earth triple tags.
Luna Metropolis.reasoning: The 'third Cartel' - excellent with Earth tag heavy strategies. With 4+ Earth tags it provides massive MC production plus a city and VP. Ti-payable via Space tag. Triple tag (City, Space, Earth) is extremely versatile. No requirements. The city on reserved area doesn't score greenery adjacency but contributes to Mayor milestone. Best with Point Luna, Teractor, or Earth Office.
Luna Metropolis.when_to_pick: When you have 3+ Earth tags or are building Earth tag strategy. Excellent titanium dump. Good for Banker/Mayor.

Natural Preserve.name: Natural Preserve
Natural Preserve.economy: Cost 9+3=12 MC (steel payable). Value: 1 VP (5) + 1 MC-prod (5-6) + Science+Building tags (4-7) + tile placement (teleport, 2-4 bonus). Total ~16-22 MC. Net +4-10.
Natural Preserve.reasoning: Underrated card with excellent tags (Science+Building), a tile for teleporting, VP, and some MC production. Max 4% O2 limits it to early game but that's when you want production anyway. icehawk84 rates it often a high priority. The tile placement on Elysium can grab the 3-card spot. Steel payable is nice.
