Small Animals.reasoning: Half-VP animals are significantly weaker than full-VP ones like Birds/Fish. 2 VP for 9 MC is decent but not exciting. The -1 plant prod in 3P is a minor take-that penalty. Animal tag provides Eco Zone/Decomposers synergy. benbever notes it is good with Large Convoy placement. Solid but uninspiring.
Small Animals.when_to_pick: When you need an animal tag/placement target and have no better options. Mid-game play.

Urban Decomposers.name: Urban Decomposers
Urban Decomposers.economy: 6+3=9 MC for 1 plant-prod (8 MC) + 2 microbes on another card (~2-5 MC) + Microbe tag (~1-2 MC). Req 1 city + 1 colony. Total ~11-15 MC value.
Urban Decomposers.reasoning: Decent cheap card when requirements are met (usually gen 2-3). benbever says 9 MC for a plant production is 'not bad at all' and the 2 microbes add value. Similar to Archaebacteria but for mid-game. The dual requirement of city + colony is usually easy by mid-game. Good filler with microbe synergy.
Urban Decomposers.when_to_pick: When you have a city + colony and a good microbe target. Cheap enough to include in most bio strategies.

Vesta Shipyard.name: Vesta Shipyard
Vesta Shipyard.economy: 15+3=18 MC (ti-payable) for 1 ti-prod (12.5 MC) + 1 VP (5 MC) + Jovian+Space tags (~5-7 MC). Total value ~23-25 MC. Jovian tag premium: only paying ~1 MC for the tag.
Vesta Shipyard.reasoning: benbever calculates you pay only 1 MC for the Jovian tag over the ti-prod + VP. With Saturn Systems, it's excellent (+1 MC-prod too). The Jovian tag adds multiplier potential. shai_aus says 'decent.' Late game it's a ti dump for 1 VP. Solid Jovian economy card but not spectacular on its own.
Vesta Shipyard.when_to_pick: With Jovian strategy or Saturn Systems. Also fine as early ti-prod + Jovian tag. Skip if no Jovian synergy.

Venus Shuttles.name: Venus Shuttles
Venus Shuttles.economy: 9+3=12 MC for action: add 2 floaters to Venus card. Venus tag (2-3 MC). Floaters accumulate slowly. 2 floaters/gen supports Venus raise via Dirigibles (2 floaters = 1 Venus step). Net value depends on floater usage. Break-even gen 4-5.
Venus Shuttles.reasoning: Floater generation action for Venus engines. 2 floaters per gen is decent but slow -- need a strong Venus floater target (Dirigibles, Stratospheric Birds, Floating Habs) to convert floaters into VP or TR. Venus tag triggers Aphrodite and Venus counting cards. The 12 MC cost is moderate for a support card. Without good floater targets this is dead weight. In Venus-focused games with Dirigibles it becomes much stronger as each action effectively = 1 Venus raise. Otherwise it is a slow floater drip.
Venus Shuttles.when_to_pick: When running Venus floater strategy with Dirigibles or Floating Habs. Skip without strong floater payoffs. Venus tag is the floor value.

Energy Tapping.name: Energy Tapping
Energy Tapping.economy: 3+3=6 MC for steal 1 energy-prod (7 MC gained for you, ~7 MC lost for opponent) - 1 VP (5 MC). Power tag (2-3 MC). Net +3-4 MC. Take-that penalty in 3P: -5 to -10 MC score adjustment.
Energy Tapping.reasoning: Cheap Power tag with take-that energy steal. The energy steal is worth ~14 MC swing (7 MC for you + 7 MC denied to opponent) but the -1 VP and 3P take-that dynamics reduce the value significantly. Helps third player by weakening one opponent. Power tag is the main draw for milestone/award and energy requirements. In 2P this would be much stronger. In 3P/WGT the take-that penalty caps it at C-tier. Only worth it when the Power tag matters or when the target has excess energy.
Energy Tapping.when_to_pick: When you need a cheap Power tag and the energy steal target has excess energy they cannot use. Skip if target is using all their energy -- helps third player too much.

Summit Logistics.name: Summit Logistics
Summit Logistics.economy: 10+3=13 MC for 1 MC per planet tag + colony + 2 cards drawn (6 MC). Building+Space tags (3-5 MC). Scientists ruling req. With 3 planet tags + 2 colonies = 5 MC + 6 MC cards + tags. Total ~14-16 MC. Net +1 to +3 MC.
Summit Logistics.reasoning: Solid but requires Scientists ruling or 2 delegates in Scientists party. Building+Space dual tag is premium (steel and ti payable). 2 cards drawn = 6 MC value. The MC per planet tag + colony is variable but typically 3-6 MC in all-expansion games. The Scientists requirement is the main barrier -- not always controllable. When it fires with good tag count and card draw, it is efficient. But the conditional nature and moderate payoff keep it in C-tier.
Summit Logistics.when_to_pick: When Scientists are ruling or you have 2 delegates there. Best with 3+ planet tags and colonies. Skip if Scientists party is not accessible.

Vermin.name: Vermin
Vermin.economy: 8+3=11 MC for Microbe+Animal tags (4-6 MC combo) + action: accumulate animals. If 10+ animals reached (5+ gens), ALL players lose 1 VP per city. Net value depends on city differential. VP attack is symmetric but city-light players benefit.
Vermin.reasoning: Unique griefing card with Microbe+Animal dual tag. The 10-animal threshold takes 5+ gens to reach, making the VP attack a late-game threat. If you have fewer cities than opponents, the symmetric -1 VP/city benefits you. The Microbe+Animal tag combo is premium for Ecological Zone, Decomposers, Advanced Ecosystems. Most of the value is in the tags rather than the VP attack mechanic. The action to add animals is free. In practice, the VP attack rarely fires (need 10 animals = gen 5 at earliest) and is hard to control.
Vermin.when_to_pick: For the Microbe+Animal tag combo, not the VP attack. Best with bio-tag synergies. The VP mechanic is a bonus if game goes long and you have few cities.

16 Psyche.name: 16 Psyche
16 Psyche.economy: 31+3=34 MC for 2 ti-prod (25 MC) + 3 ti (9 MC) + 2 VP (10 MC) = 44 MC value. Net +10, but heavy upfront cost. Ti-payable via Space tag helps. 4.25 MC/ti-prod effective.
16 Psyche.reasoning: Decent ti-production card with 2 VP and immediate titanium, but very expensive upfront (34 MC). The Space tag helps pay with titanium. Comparable to Asteroid Mining but slightly better value due to immediate ti and lower real cost after ti offset. Still, the high investment gen 1 is crippling and you need space cards to spend the titanium on.
16 Psyche.when_to_pick: When you have ti-production or Phobolog and need a ti dump with VP. Best gen 1-2, skip after gen 3.

Breathing Filters.name: Breathing Filters
Breathing Filters.economy: 11+3=14 MC for 2 VP (10 MC) + Science tag (3-5 MC). Total ~13-15 MC. Fair value. 7% oxygen requirement is mid-game.
Breathing Filters.reasoning: Simple VP card: 2 VP + Science tag for 14 MC. At 7 MC/VP, it is fair but not exciting. The Science tag adds value for engine players needing science requirements. The 7% oxygen requirement means mid-to-late game play, which is fine since VP cards are better later. Consistent, reliable, never exciting. Good Science tag enabler when you need one more.
Breathing Filters.when_to_pick: When you need a Science tag and 7% oxygen is close. Acceptable as a late-game VP dump. Not high priority.

Building Industries.name: Building Industries
Building Industries.economy: 6+3=9 MC + 1 energy-prod (~7.5 MC) = 16.5 MC effective. 2 steel-prod (16 MC). Building tag (1-2 MC). Fair conversion.
Building Industries.reasoning: Cheap energy-to-steel conversion at 9 MC sticker price. If you have unused energy production, converting 1 energy-prod to 2 steel-prod is excellent (energy=7.5, steel=16). But if you need a SP Power Plant for the energy, total cost balloons to 20 MC. The Building tag is useful for milestones. Best with excess energy from other cards. Situationally good but requires the right setup.
Building Industries.when_to_pick: When you have energy-prod to spare and want steel for building cards. Gen 1-3 with energy prelude.

Diaspora Movement.name: Diaspora Movement
Diaspora Movement.economy: 7 MC + 3 MC card = 10 MC cost. Returns: 1 VP (~5 MC late) + X MC where X = Jovian tags in play. With 3-4 Jovian tags: 3-4 MC back. Net cost ~3-6 MC for 1 VP + Jovian tag (~4 MC).
Diaspora Movement.reasoning: A niche Jovian tag card with 1 VP. The MC gain is nice but not transformative. The Reds ruling requirement adds friction — you may need to spend delegates. Per benbever, with Jovian multipliers this can be worth up to 5 VP, but that's the ceiling case. The Jovian tag is the real value. Boring but occasionally useful.
Diaspora Movement.when_to_pick: Mid-late game with 2+ Jovian tags and Reds conveniently ruling or delegates to spare.

Floater Technology.name: Floater Technology
Floater Technology.economy: 7 MC + 3 MC card = 10 MC cost. Action: 1 floater to ANOTHER card per gen. Science tag (~4 MC). Floater value depends on target: ~1.5-3 MC per gen effective.
Floater Technology.reasoning: An affordable Science tag with floater dispensing action. Per benbever, the floater can translate to half a card, half a TR, or half a VP per gen depending on target. At 10 MC total with the Science tag, it's reasonable if you have even one good floater target. Per PanzerWatts, without a floater target the 10 MC Science tag is expensive compared to other options. Cheap enough for low-risk speculation.
Floater Technology.when_to_pick: Gen 1-4 with at least one floater card in play. Good cheap Science tag for Warp Drive or Anti-Gravity requirements.

Fuel Factory.name: Fuel Factory
Fuel Factory.economy: 6 MC (steel payable) + 3 MC card + ~7 MC energy prod = ~16 MC cost. Returns: 1 ti-prod (~12.5 MC gen1) + 1 MC-prod (~5 MC gen1) + Building tag (~2 MC). Total ~19.5 MC.
Fuel Factory.reasoning: Decent value if you have spare energy production, but a trap if you need to buy energy. Per icehawk84, top 10 overrated card — people overplay it mid-game. Per shai_aus, it's not as cheap as it appears due to hidden energy cost. Per benbever, good value for money gen 1 with pre-existing energy production. The titanium production is the draw, but only worthwhile if you have space cards to spend it on.
Fuel Factory.when_to_pick: Gen 1-2 with spare energy production from preludes/corp. Skip if you'd need to SP Power Plant first.

Herbivores.name: Herbivores
Herbivores.economy: 12 MC + 3 MC card = 15 MC. 8% oxygen requirement = mid-late game. Gains ~1 VP per 2 greeneries placed (by anyone). Self-scores 2-4 VP typically. Take-that component (-1 plant prod) in 3P is a minus.
Herbivores.reasoning: Interesting VP-generating animal card but awkward execution. The 8% oxygen requirement means it comes online mid-late game when fewer greeneries are being placed. The 1/2 VP per resource ratio is half of Birds/Fish. Plant prod attack in 3P helps the third player. Better in base game without expansions diluting the deck.
Herbivores.when_to_pick: When you need an animal tag and can't find Birds/Fish/Livestock. Better in plant-heavy metagames where many greeneries are placed.

Inventors' Guild.name: Inventors' Guild
Inventors' Guild.economy: 9 MC + 3 MC card = 12 MC for Science tag + repeatable card draw (3 MC per card kept). Over 5 gens: 5 draws, maybe keep 3 = 12 + 9 = 21 MC for 3 cards. ~7 MC/card is expensive.
Inventors' Guild.reasoning: Continuous card draw is powerful in TM but this implementation is expensive and slow. At 12 MC upfront plus 3 MC per card kept, the per-card cost is high. In 8-gen games with WGT, you get maybe 4-5 uses which isn't enough to justify the investment. Better in longer 2P games. The Science tag is its saving grace for milestone/payoff purposes.
Inventors' Guild.when_to_pick: Gen 2-3 when building science engine and game looks to go 9+ gens. Pass in short 8-gen games unless you need the Science tag.

Lake Marineris.name: Lake Marineris
Lake Marineris.economy: 18 MC + 3 MC card = 21 MC. 2 VP + 2 oceans (2 TR + placement bonuses). At full value: ~24-28 MC. But requires 0C AND 2 ocean spots available. No tags = -3 to -5 penalty.
Lake Marineris.reasoning: When played for full value (both oceans), it's one of the best cards in the game. But the 0C requirement combined with needing 2 ocean spots makes full value uncommon in 3P. Oceans typically fill before temp hits 0C. No tags means no discounts, no synergies. Even for 2 VP alone at 21 MC it's poor. High variance card - amazing ceiling, disappointing floor.
Lake Marineris.when_to_pick: Speculate in opening hand if you plan to rush temperature. Draft mid-game only if oceans remain near 0C temp.

Lichen.name: Lichen
Lichen.economy: 7 MC + 3 MC card = 10 MC for 1 plant prod (~8 MC) + Plant tag (~2 MC). Requires -24C. Total: ~10 MC value. Fair price.
Lichen.reasoning: Decent cheap plant card playable relatively early (-24C is often gen 1-2). The Plant tag is valuable for NRA, Insects, and Ecologist milestone. At 10 MC for 10 MC value it's break-even, but the early playability and tag value push it to useful territory. Not exciting but reliable. Good role-player for plant strategies.
Lichen.when_to_pick: When building plant strategy and need cheap plant tags. Draft priority goes up with NRA/Insects in hand.

Lightning Harvest.name: Lightning Harvest
Lightning Harvest.economy: 8 MC + 3 MC card = 11 MC for 1 energy prod (~7.5 MC) + 1 MC-prod (~5 MC) + 1 VP (~5 MC) + Power tag (~1 MC). Requires 3 Science tags. Total: ~18.5 MC value.
Lightning Harvest.reasoning: Good value at 11 MC for ~18 MC when requirements are met. The 3 Science tag requirement limits it to science engine players who often have better options (Quantum Extractor, Mass Converter). The Power tag is niche. The card is efficient but rarely urgent or game-changing. You need to happen to have 3 Science tags, need energy, and have this in hand simultaneously.
Lightning Harvest.when_to_pick: When you have 3+ Science tags and need energy production. Good incidental value, not a strategy-defining pick.

Lunar Beam.name: Lunar Beam
Lunar Beam.economy: 13 MC + 3 MC card + 10 MC (-2 MC-prod) = ~26 MC effective cost. Gain 2 heat prod (~8 MC) + 2 energy prod (~15 MC) + Earth+Power tags (~3 MC) = ~26 MC value. Break-even.
Lunar Beam.reasoning: Fair-priced but painful production card. The -2 MC-prod is a significant hit early game when MC is most valuable. The combined heat + energy production is strong for rushing or colony trading. Earth+Power tags provide some synergy value. Much better with Teractor/Earth Office where the MC-prod loss is offset. Good for heat terraforming strategy that also needs energy.
Lunar Beam.when_to_pick: Gen 1-2 when going heat rush AND need energy for colonies/other cards. Better with Earth tag discounts.

Magnetic Shield.name: Magnetic Shield
Magnetic Shield.economy: Cost 24+3=27 MC (ti payable). Value: 4 TR = ~29.6 MC. Net ~+3 MC. Space tag worth 1-2 MC. Requirement: 3 Power tags is steep.
Magnetic Shield.reasoning: Good value on paper -- 4 TR for 27 MC is solid, especially titanium-payable. But 3 Power tags is a difficult requirement that limits when this can be played. Per COTD experts, it's a fine VP dump card but you can't rely on meeting the requirements. Niche but decent when it works.
Magnetic Shield.when_to_pick: When you already have 2 power tags and titanium to spend. Late-game titanium dump when requirements are met.

Moss.name: Moss
Moss.economy: Cost 4+3=7 MC - 1 plant (~2). Value: 1 plant-prod (8 MC) + Plant tag (1-2). Total ~9-10 MC. Net ~0-3 MC accounting for plant loss.
Moss.reasoning: Simple, cheap plant production with a useful Plant tag. The 3 ocean requirement is easy to meet by gen 2-3. Losing 1 plant is minor. shai_aus calls it perfectly fine mid-tier. The Plant tag is valuable for NRA/Insects. Not exciting but functional. Better as part of a plant engine than standalone.
Moss.when_to_pick: Gen 2-4 when 3 oceans are out and you want plant production or a cheap plant tag.

Nuclear Power.name: Nuclear Power
Nuclear Power.economy: Cost 10+3=13 MC (steel payable) + 2 MC-prod lost (10). Total ~23 MC gen 1. Value: 3 energy-prod (22.5). Net ~-0.5 MC gen 1, better mid-game.
Nuclear Power.reasoning: Good when you need lots of energy (colonies trading, oxygen bumpers, Physics Complex). The -2 MC-prod hurts early but matters less mid-late game. benbever notes mid-game effective cost is only ~19 MC for 3 energy. Power+Building tags are useful. Preferred: Peroxide Power for smaller needs.
Nuclear Power.when_to_pick: When you specifically need 3 energy production. With colonies it's good in opening hand. Without specific energy needs, skip.

Permafrost Extraction.name: Permafrost Extraction
Permafrost Extraction.economy: Cost 8+3=11 MC. Value: 1 ocean (TR 7-7.4 + placement bonus 2-6). Total ~9-13 MC. No tags = penalty (-3 to -5). Req: -8C.
Permafrost Extraction.reasoning: Cheap ocean that's 7 MC less than SP, which is good value. But the -8C requirement means it's mid-game at earliest, and no tags means penalty. Risk of oceans being maxed by the time temperature reaches -8C. shai_aus rates it fine with manageable requirement. Better with event rebates (IC, Media Group).
Permafrost Extraction.when_to_pick: When temperature is near -8C and oceans remain. Don't speculate early. Good as mid-game free draw.

Rad-Chem Factory.name: Rad-Chem Factory
Rad-Chem Factory.economy: 11 MC total (8+3) + 1 energy prod (~7.5 MC) = effective ~18.5 MC for 2 TR (~14.8 MC). Slight overpay but Building tag + steel payable helps. Late game: 11 MC for 2 VP = 5.5 MC/VP.
Rad-Chem Factory.reasoning: Decent late-game VP card when you have excess energy. icehawk84 calls it 'Bad-chem Factory' but acknowledges it is not terrible with steel. The -1 energy prod makes early play expensive. Best as last-gen steel dump with spare energy. Building tag helps for milestones.
Rad-Chem Factory.when_to_pick: Late game when you have excess energy production and steel. Not worth drafting early.

Rego Plastics.name: Rego Plastics
Rego Plastics.economy: 13 MC total (10+3) for steel +1 value + 1 VP + Building tag. Need to spend ~8 steel after playing to break even. With 2+ steel prod, effectively 2 MC-prod equivalent.
Rego Plastics.reasoning: Decent with significant steel production, but steel is often hard to spend on building cards late game. shai_aus says it is 'pretty severely overrated' for most games. 1 VP provides floor value. Building tag helps. Worse than Advanced Alloys. Best with IC opening hand or high steel production.
Rego Plastics.when_to_pick: When you have 2+ steel production and many building cards to play. Late game it is just 1 VP.

Shuttles.name: Shuttles
Shuttles.economy: 13 MC total (10+3) + 1 energy prod (~7.5 MC) = effective ~20.5 MC for 2 MC-prod (~10 MC) + 2 MC space discount/card + 1 VP + Space tag. Requires 5% O2.
Shuttles.reasoning: Mid-game engine card that loses to the timing problem: by 5% O2, MC production matters less. -1 energy is painful. icehawk84 says 'low impact' and prefers Space Station. shai_aus is skeptical. The space discount is decent for heavy space strategies but the card comes online too late for the production to matter much.
Shuttles.when_to_pick: Mid-game for space engine builders with excess energy. Not a high priority card.

Small Asteroid.name: Small Asteroid
Small Asteroid.economy: 13 MC total (10+3) for 1 temp TR (~7-7.4 MC) + remove 2 plants + Space tag. Ti payable. Slightly better than SP asteroid (14 MC). Minor take-that in 3P.
Small Asteroid.reasoning: Cheap temperature raise with Space tag, titanium payable. Slightly better than Standard Project. Plant removal is minor in 3P (take-that penalty applies weakly). COTD consensus: 'fine but not exciting.' Better with Optimal Aerobraking. Low-impact, reliable filler card.
Small Asteroid.when_to_pick: When you need temperature TR and have titanium or space discounts. Decent filler.

Solarnet.name: Solarnet
Solarnet.economy: 10 MC total (7+3) for 2 cards (~8 MC) + 1 VP (~5 MC). No tags = -3 to -5 penalty. Req: Venus+Earth+Jovian tags. Total value ~13 MC but requires triple planetary requirement.
Solarnet.reasoning: Decent card draw + VP but the triple planetary requirement (Venus+Earth+Jovian) is restrictive and hard to meet early when card draw matters most. No tags is a significant penalty. Compared unfavorably to Research (4 MC more but double science tag and no requirements). shai_aus: 'slightly better but harder to play SF Memorial.'
Solarnet.when_to_pick: Only when you already meet Venus+Earth+Jovian requirements. Not worth forcing.

Subterranean Reservoir.name: Subterranean Reservoir
Subterranean Reservoir.economy: 11+3=14 MC for 1 ocean (1 TR = 7 MC + placement bonus ~2-4 MC). SP ocean costs 18 MC, saving 4 MC. No tags (event, but no tag value). No-tag penalty applies partially.
Subterranean Reservoir.reasoning: A cheaper ocean - simple and functional. benbever notes the 4 MC savings plus placement bonuses. No tags is a downside, but event tag counts for Legend/Media Group. icehawk84 says 'usually not too excited unless I have event rebates.' Decent but not exciting.
Subterranean Reservoir.when_to_pick: When you need an ocean and have MC but no better options. Good for ocean-walking combos.

Venus Governor.name: Venus Governor
Venus Governor.economy: 4+3=7 MC for 2 MC-prod (10-12 MC) + 2 Venus tags (~4-5 MC). Req 2 Venus tags. At 7 MC for 2 MC-prod, that's 3.5 MC/prod - excellent if played gen 1. Venuphile award clincher.
Venus Governor.reasoning: Sponsors but cheaper and with Venus tags instead of Earth. benbever notes it's great value if played early. The 2 Venus tag requirement limits early play in most games, but Morning Star Inc and Venus Waystation make it free. FieldMouse007 calls it 'mediocre' because buying it doubles the cost and Venus tags have less value than Earth.
Venus Governor.when_to_pick: Gen 1-2 if you already have 2 Venus tags. Clinches Venuphile. With discounts it's essentially free value.

Venus Trade Hub.name: Venus Trade Hub
Venus Trade Hub.economy: 12+3=15 MC (ti-payable) for effect (likely trade bonus) + 1 VP + Venus+Space tags. No COTD data. Req 2 Venus tags. Comparable to other Venus combo enablers.
Venus Trade Hub.reasoning: No COTD data available. Based on cost structure: 15 MC ti-payable for 1 VP + effect + Venus+Space tags. The 2 Venus tag requirement limits use. With Colonies compatibility, likely a trade-enhancing effect. The Venus+Space dual tag helps with Venuphile and ti-payment. Mid-tier Venus support card.
Venus Trade Hub.when_to_pick: When playing Venus + Colonies combo and have 2+ Venus tags. Ti-payable makes it accessible.

Casinos.name: Casinos
Casinos.economy: 5+3=8 MC + energy-prod (~7 MC) = 15 MC effective. 4 MC-prod (20-24 MC gen 1-2). Requires 1 city. Building tag (steel). Net +5-9 MC gen 1-2. Break-even gen 3.
Casinos.reasoning: Strong MC-production rate at 3.75 MC/prod effective cost, but two hard requirements: city already placed AND energy production to sacrifice. The Building tag for steel payability helps. In practice, having a city + energy by gen 2-3 in 3P/WGT is not guaranteed. When the requirements are met early, the 4 MC-prod is excellent. Late game (gen 5+) the MC-prod cannot compound enough. The energy-prod cost is the main pain point. No VP hurts.
Casinos.when_to_pick: Gen 2-3 with city already placed and energy-prod available. Steel-payable via Building tag. Skip without city or if gen 4+.

Corporate Stronghold.name: Corporate Stronghold
Corporate Stronghold.economy: 11+3=14 MC + energy-prod (~7 MC) = 21 MC effective. City tile (adjacency 2-4 MC) + 3 MC-prod (15-18 MC gen 1-2) - 2 VP (10 MC). City+Building tags (steel). Net -3 to +1 MC gen 1. Cheapest city option.
Corporate Stronghold.reasoning: Cheapest city card in the game with decent 3 MC-prod. City+Building tags provide steel payability. The -2 VP is the main penalty, making it a purely economic play. In 3P/WGT the city tile adjacency to greeneries can partially offset the -2 VP. Best as gen 1 city placement when MC-prod compounds over 7-8 gens (21-24 MC return). The energy-prod cost is standard. Compared to Open City (4 MC-prod, +1 VP but 23 MC), this trades VP for cheaper upfront cost and earlier playability.
Corporate Stronghold.when_to_pick: Gen 1-2 as cheapest city + MC-prod dump. Steel-payable priority. Accept -2 VP trade for early economy. Skip gen 4+ or if VP matters more than economy.

Floating Refinery.name: Floating Refinery
Floating Refinery.economy: 7+3=10 MC for action: add 1 floater per Venus tag. Venus tag (2-3 MC). With 3 Venus tags = 3 floaters/gen. Spend 2 floaters = 1 Venus raise + 1 TR? No -- just accumulates for VP via Floating Habs. Slow engine.
Floating Refinery.reasoning: Cheap Venus floater generator that scales with Venus tag count. At 10 MC it is affordable but the value depends entirely on floater payoffs. Without Floating Habs, Dirigibles, or other floater-to-value converters, the floaters sit idle. With 3+ Venus tags the floater generation is decent (3/gen). Venus tag adds to count. The card is a support piece, not a standalone -- it needs synergy to justify the slot. In Venus-heavy games with payoff targets it is solid; without them it is a wasted card slot.
Floating Refinery.when_to_pick: When running Venus floater strategy with 2+ Venus tags and floater payoff targets. Skip without Floating Habs or Dirigibles. Venus tag is floor value.

Media Archives.name: Media Archives
Media Archives.economy: Cost 8+3=11 MC. Value: 1 MC per event ever played. In 3P by late game ~12-18 events = 12-18 MC. Net +1-7 MC. Earth tag (2-3).
Media Archives.reasoning: Late-game money bomb that's hard to time well. In 3P, events accumulate reasonably but you can't play this early (not enough events). icehawk84 says it's almost always strong late in 3P+. The Earth tag adds value. But it occupies hand space while providing zero value until played. Inferior to Investment Loan in flexibility.
Media Archives.when_to_pick: Mid-to-late game when ~15+ events have been played. Don't speculate on it early unless cash is abundant.

Spin-Inducing Asteroid.name: Spin-Inducing Asteroid
Spin-Inducing Asteroid.economy: 19 MC total (16+3) for 2 Venus TR (~14.8 MC). Ti payable. Space event tag. Max 10% Venus requirement limits timing. Slight overpay.
Spin-Inducing Asteroid.reasoning: Previously evaluated at 61/C in calibration data. 2 Venus TR for 19 MC is slightly overpriced. Max 10% Venus limits to early game. Space event tag allows titanium payment and event rebates. Better with Venus payoffs (Venusian Animals, Strato Birds). icehawk84 says 'not the worst if you have Venus payoffs.'
Spin-Inducing Asteroid.when_to_pick: Early game when Venus is low and you have Venus strategy cards. With discounts it becomes efficient.

Symbiotic Fungus.name: Symbiotic Fungus
Symbiotic Fungus.economy: 4+3=7 MC for action: add 1 microbe to any card. At 1/2 VP per microbe (Ants, Decomposers): 0.5 VP/gen = 2.5 MC/gen. Microbe tag worth ~1-2 MC. Req -14C.
Symbiotic Fungus.reasoning: Cheap and can add meaningful VP to microbe cards over several gens. icehawk84 notes for 2 MC more you could play Small Animals which gives 0.5 VP/gen without a target. FieldMouse007 says 'as long as it gives 2+ points, it's very good.' The -14C requirement delays deployment. Needs good microbe targets to shine.
Symbiotic Fungus.when_to_pick: When you have a microbe VP card to feed. Draft speculatively even without one - cheap enough to gamble on finding a target.

Weather Balloons.name: Weather Balloons
Weather Balloons.economy: 11+3=14 MC for Science tag (3-5 MC) + draw 1 card (3 MC) + action: add floater. 1 VP potential if used as floater target. Total value ~8-10 MC from immediate effects. Net -4 to -6 MC upfront, but action provides ongoing floater value.
Weather Balloons.reasoning: Science tag with card draw and floater action. The 14 MC upfront for Science tag + 1 card is overpriced compared to Invention Contest (3 MC for 1 of 3 cards). The floater action adds slow value if used as floater target for other cards. Main value is the Science tag for AI Central, Mars University, Olympus Conference triggers. Without Science tag needs, this is too expensive. The floater accumulation can provide VP via Floating Habs count but this is slow and conditional.
Weather Balloons.when_to_pick: When you need a Science tag and the card draw + floater action add marginal value. Skip without Science tag synergies -- too expensive for the raw value.

Advertising.name: Advertising
Advertising.economy: 4+3=7 MC for Earth tag (2-3 MC) + effect. Need 2 triggers (20+ MC cards) for 10 MC production value. Break-even requires 2 expensive cards played early.
Advertising.reasoning: Cheap Earth tag with a conditional effect. The trigger (playing 20+ MC cards) is achievable but not guaranteed -- only ~17% of cards cost 20+. Need at least 2 triggers to be worth it. Good with Credicor and Point Luna. Mostly a cheap Earth tag enabler rather than a strong economy card. In 3P/WGT the game is shorter, making triggers harder to accumulate.
Advertising.when_to_pick: Gen 1 with 2+ expensive cards in hand and/or Point Luna/Credicor. Otherwise treat as a cheap Earth tag.

Beam From A Thorium Asteroid.name: Beam From A Thorium Asteroid
Beam From A Thorium Asteroid.economy: 32+3=35 MC for 3 heat-prod (12 MC) + 3 energy-prod (22.5 MC) + 1 VP (5 MC) + Jovian+Space+Power tags (~6-8 MC). Value ~45 MC. Good if played early. Ti-payable.
Beam From A Thorium Asteroid.reasoning: Great production value on paper (45 MC worth of stuff), but the 35 MC upfront cost and Jovian tag requirement make it hard to deploy early when the production matters most. With Colonies, 3 energy-prod is very useful for trading. With ti-payment the effective cost drops significantly. But the Jovian requirement means you need Saturn Systems, a Jovian prelude, or another expensive Jovian card first. Situationally strong, often stranded in hand.
Beam From A Thorium Asteroid.when_to_pick: Gen 1-3 with Saturn Systems or Jovian prelude + titanium. Excellent with Colonies for energy. Skip without Jovian tag.

Deuterium Export.name: Deuterium Export
Deuterium Export.economy: 11 MC + 3 MC card = 14 MC cost. Action: 1 floater per gen, convert to energy-prod. Gives ~1 energy-prod every 2 gens = ~3.75 MC/gen average. Triple tag value (Space+Venus+Power) ~5 MC.
Deuterium Export.reasoning: Slow energy production generator with 3 useful tags. On its own, getting energy production every other gen is underwhelming. But with Celestic/Stormcraft for floaters every gen, it becomes solid. The triple tag is genuinely valuable for Diversifier and Aridor. Per icehawk84, it can be very good with Celestic specifically; otherwise mostly ignorable.
Deuterium Export.when_to_pick: With floater-generating corporations or when you need the triple tag for Diversifier. Otherwise low priority.

GHG Import From Venus.name: GHG Import From Venus
GHG Import From Venus.economy: 23 MC (ti payable) + 3 MC card = 26 MC cost. Returns: 1 Venus TR (~7.2 MC) + 3 heat-prod (~12 MC gen1) + Space+Venus+Event tags (~5 MC). Total ~24.2 MC.
GHG Import From Venus.reasoning: Overpriced bundle of Venus TR and heat production. At 26 MC for ~24 MC value, it's slightly below cost even at gen 1 valuations. The triple tag (Space+Venus+Event) is the best feature. Ti payability helps with Phobolog. Per community assessment, it's rarely exciting — you're paying premium for Venus you might not want and heat production that's mediocre. Better with Aphrodite or Terraforming Deal for Venus TR bonus.
GHG Import From Venus.when_to_pick: Early game with titanium to spend and Venus TR synergies. Skip if you don't benefit from Venus.

Hi-Tech Lab.name: Hi-Tech Lab
Hi-Tech Lab.economy: 17 MC + 3 MC card = 20 MC. 1 VP. Action: spend N energy to look at N cards, keep 1. Each use costs energy resources (~1.5 MC each). Net card quality improvement worth ~2-3 MC per use above base.
Hi-Tech Lab.reasoning: Expensive for what it does. The action is essentially paying energy to get a curated card draw, but you only keep 1 card regardless of how many you spend. Science + Building tags are good, and 1 VP helps, but 20 MC upfront is steep. Works best with excess energy production from science engines but those situations are uncommon in 8-gen games.
Hi-Tech Lab.when_to_pick: When you have strong energy production and need card filtering. Science engine support piece. Pass in most situations.

Immigrant City.name: Immigrant City
Immigrant City.economy: 13 MC + 3 MC card + 7.5 MC (1 energy prod) + 10 MC (2 MC-prod loss) = ~33.5 MC. City tile worth ~2 VP. Effect: +1 MC-prod per city placed. Need 5+ cities to recover production loss.
Immigrant City.reasoning: Classic noob trap when played early. The production hit is devastating in competitive 3P games where not enough cities are placed to justify it. Per icehawk84 stats, early play has a very bad win rate in 3P. However, as a late-game cheap city (steel payable, -2 MC-prod is irrelevant last gen) it's decent. Building + City tags are valuable.
Immigrant City.when_to_pick: Late game as a cheap city tile and steel dump. Do NOT play early in 3P despite the temptation.

Import of Advanced GHG.name: Import of Advanced GHG
Import of Advanced GHG.economy: 9 MC + 3 MC card = 12 MC for 2 heat prod (~8 MC gen 1). At 6 MC per heat prod, it's ok in gen 1. Earth+Space event tags enable heavy discounts.
Import of Advanced GHG.reasoning: Fair-priced heat production card that improves dramatically with discounts. Earth+Space event tags open up the most discount possibilities in the game (Optimal Aerobraking, Media Group, IC, Earth Office, etc.). Without discounts it's merely average at 6 MC per heat prod. With 2-3 discounts it becomes good. Better in gen 1 when heat prod has full value.
Import of Advanced GHG.when_to_pick: Gen 1-2 when going for heat terraforming and have discount infrastructure. With Optimal Aerobraking it's excellent.

Industrial Center.name: Industrial Center
Industrial Center.economy: 4 MC + 3 MC card = 7 MC. Building tag. Tile placement adjacent to city. Action: spend 7 MC for 1 steel prod. Steel prod action is rarely worth it.
Industrial Center.reasoning: Cheap tile placement that can grab placement bonuses and block opponent greenery spots. The steel production action is almost never worth using in 3P all-expansions where games are short. Primary value is as a cheap Building tag, tile placement for bonuses, and positional disruption. Good for Builder milestone. Teleport value near cities.
Industrial Center.when_to_pick: When good placement bonuses are available near cities, or need Building tag for milestone. Don't count on the action.

Martian Survey.name: Martian Survey
Martian Survey.economy: Cost 9+3=12 MC. Value: 2 cards (6-8) + 1 VP (5) + Science tag (3-5). Total ~14-18 MC. Decent but max 4% O2 limits timing.
Martian Survey.reasoning: Overpriced for what it does without discounts. 12 MC for 2 blind draws + 1 VP is mediocre early game when you'd rather have production. The max 4% O2 requirement means it can only be played early. With rebates (IC, Media Group, Valley Trust) it becomes much better. Science+Event tags enable combos.
Martian Survey.when_to_pick: When you have event/science rebates. Also good for Legend milestone. Don't speculate on it if O2 might spike early.

Minority Refuge.name: Minority Refuge
Minority Refuge.economy: Cost 5+3=8 MC + 2 MC-prod lost (10). Total effective ~18 MC for a colony (SP costs 17). Space tag (1-2). Late game: -2 prod irrelevant.
Minority Refuge.reasoning: Early game it's slightly worse than SP colony due to MC-prod loss. But it's titanium-payable via Space tag and gets better late-game when the -2 MC-prod doesn't matter. Good for grabbing placement bonuses (Europa ocean, Miranda animal) cheaply in final gens. benbever provides detailed analysis of niche scenarios.
Minority Refuge.when_to_pick: Late game for colony placement bonuses when -2 MC-prod is irrelevant. Early game only if securing a critical colony spot.

Mohole Lake.name: Mohole Lake
Mohole Lake.economy: Cost 31+3=34 MC (steel payable). Value: 1 temp TR (10) + 1 ocean (14) + 3 plants (7.5) + action (microbe or animal). Total ~31.5 + action. Slightly negative base.
Mohole Lake.reasoning: Big, expensive card that does many things but none amazingly. The terraforming value roughly equals cost. The action is nice with GHG Bacteria or 1VP animals but requires additional cards. Steel-payable is a big plus. COTD consensus: it's okay but conflicted between terraforming and engine. Best as a steel dump with a microbe/animal target.
Mohole Lake.when_to_pick: With excess steel AND a microbe/animal target for the action. Don't play just for the terraforming.

Omnicourt.name: Omnicourt
Omnicourt.economy: Cost 11+3=14 MC (steel payable). Value: 2 TR (14.8) + Building tag (1-2). Total ~16 MC. Net ~+2 MC. Req: Venus+Earth+Jovian tags.
Omnicourt.reasoning: 2 TR for 14 MC steel-payable is decent. The triple planetary tag requirement limits when you can play it. icehawk84 rates it what Release of Inert Gases should have been. FieldMouse007 calls it mediocre. As a steel dump with tags already met, it's fine. Not worth bending strategy for.
Omnicourt.when_to_pick: When you naturally have Venus+Earth+Jovian tags and excess steel. Late-game steel dump for TR.

Political Alliance.name: Political Alliance
Political Alliance.economy: Cost 4+3=7 MC. Value: 1 TR (7-7.4). No tags = penalty (-3 to -5). Req: 2 party leaders. Net ~-2 to -5 MC with tag penalty.
Political Alliance.reasoning: Cheap TR card that's decent when the requirement is met. No tags is a penalty. benbever rates it good, noting 2 party leaders isn't hard in low player counts. It's a useful event for Legend milestone. shai_aus finds it boring but playable. The Turmoil requirement limits availability. Overall a filler card with narrow upside.
Political Alliance.when_to_pick: When you have 2 party leaders and need cheap TR. Good for Legend milestone. Low priority in draft.

Power Supply Consortium.name: Power Supply Consortium
Power Supply Consortium.economy: 8 MC total (5+3) for 1 energy prod. Fair price, but requires 2 Power tags (hard to meet early). Take-that component hurts in 3P format.
Power Supply Consortium.reasoning: The attack is meaningful but the 2 Power tag requirement is restrictive and often hard to fulfill when you most need it. In 3P, stealing energy helps the third player. icehawk84 notes Energy Tapping is slightly better due to no requirement. Decent but situational.
Power Supply Consortium.when_to_pick: When you already have 2 Power tags and can disrupt an opponent's plans. Less useful in 3P than 2P.

Red Appeasement.name: Red Appeasement
Red Appeasement.economy: 3 MC total (0+3) for 2 MC-prod (~10-12 MC early). Requires Reds ruling or 2 delegates + no other player passed. Forces you to pass immediately.
Red Appeasement.reasoning: Excellent efficiency when it works - 3 MC for 2 MC-prod is outstanding. But the requirement is very restrictive: Reds ruling is uncommon, and 'no other player passed' limits timing. Passing immediately is a significant cost. No tags penalty. benbever rates it well but acknowledges it is hard to trigger.
Red Appeasement.when_to_pick: When Reds are ruling and you are first to act. Very niche but powerful when conditions align.

Solar Probe.name: Solar Probe
Solar Probe.economy: 12 MC total (9+3) for X cards (1 per 3 science tags including this) + 1 VP + Space+Science event tags. Ti payable. With 5 tags: 2 cards. With 8: 3 cards.
Solar Probe.reasoning: Expensive for card draw unless you have many science tags. icehawk84 says 'event tag really hurts - below 5 tags it is worse than Lagrange Observatory.' Krazyguy75 agrees it is overpriced. At 5+ science tags it becomes decent. 1 VP + event with Space tag means discounts/rebates can help. C-tier for the average case.
Solar Probe.when_to_pick: Late game with 5+ science tags and space discounts. Not worth forcing.

Soletta.name: Soletta
Soletta.economy: 38 MC total (35+3) for 7 heat prod (~42 MC gen 1). Ti payable. 5.43 MC per heat prod. Space tag. Huge investment for heat only.
Soletta.reasoning: Classic gen 1 rush card that has been somewhat replaced by the cheaper Solar Reflectors. 38 MC is nearly all of gen 1 budget. shai_aus says 'value drops steeply after gen 1-2.' benbever notes it is 'a few MC too expensive.' The 7 heat prod guarantees 1 temp/gen but leaves you with no other economy. Better in 2P where you control game pace more.
Soletta.when_to_pick: Gen 1 only with titanium to pay. Commits you to rush strategy. Otherwise skip.

Sponsored Mohole.name: Sponsored Mohole
Sponsored Mohole.economy: 8 MC total (5+3) for 2 heat prod (~8-12 MC). Req: Kelvinists ruling or 2 delegates. Building tag. Steel payable. 4 MC per heat prod is best rate in the game.
Sponsored Mohole.reasoning: Cheapest heat production in the game at 4 MC per prod. But Kelvinists requirement is restrictive. Krazyguy75 argues pushing Kelvinists lets opponents benefit from the ruling policy too. Building tag and steel payability help. benbever notes the 2 MC kickback when Kelvinists come to power. Good when Kelvinists align with your strategy naturally, bad when forced.
Sponsored Mohole.when_to_pick: When Kelvinists are already in power or you want them in power anyway. Do not force Kelvinists just for this.

Venus Allies.name: Venus Allies
Venus Allies.economy: 30+3=33 MC (ti-payable) for 2 Venus TR (18 MC) + 4 MC per colony + 2 VP (10 MC) + Venus+Space tags (~3-4 MC). At 2 colonies: 33-8=25 MC for 4 VP, decent. At 3: 33-12=21 MC for 4 VP, good.
Venus Allies.reasoning: No key commenter COTD data. With 2+ colonies it's a reasonable VP card. Ti-payable with Space tag helps. The 2 Venus TR raises the track which can help Venus requirements. At 3 colonies, 21 MC for 4 VP + 2 Venus TR is solid. Late game VP card that works with colony + Venus combo strategy.
Venus Allies.when_to_pick: Late game with 2+ colonies and ti to pay. Better in Venus-heavy games. Skip without colonies.

Corroder Suits.name: Corroder Suits
Corroder Suits.economy: 8+3=11 MC for 2 MC-prod (10 MC) + Venus tag (2-3 MC) + 1 Venus resource (~1-5 MC depending on target). Total ~13-18 MC.
Corroder Suits.reasoning: Essentially Sponsors +2 MC cost with a Venus tag instead of Earth tag and a bonus Venus resource. The Venus tag is less valuable than Earth tag in most games (fewer Venus synergies). The Venus resource varies from worthless (no target) to strong (1 VP animal). Early play for MC-prod is decent, late play for VP resource is decent, but the card is conflicted -- early play means no good resource target, late play means MC-prod is less valuable.
Corroder Suits.when_to_pick: Gen 1-2 for MC-prod if Venus tag helps with award/milestone. Late game if you have a 1-VP Venus animal.

Pets.name: Pets
Pets.economy: Cost 10+3=13 MC. Value: 1 VP per 2 animals. With 6-8 cities total = 3-4 VP (15-20 MC). Earth+Animal tags (3-5). Total ~18-25 MC over full game. Pure VP card.
Pets.reasoning: Pure VP card that needs early play for maximum value but conflicts with early-game economy needs. In 3P all-expansions, cities are moderate (5-8 total). shai_aus rates it medium -- good in city-heavy games, mediocre otherwise. The 1VP/2 animals ratio is worse than 1VP/1 animal cards. Earth+Animal tags have synergy value. Meat Industry combo is strong.
Pets.when_to_pick: When you expect 6+ cities and can play gen 1-2. With Meat Industry it becomes much better. Otherwise low priority.

Aqueduct Systems.name: Aqueduct Systems
Aqueduct Systems.economy: 9+3=12 MC (in steel) for 3 Building cards (9-12 MC) + 1 VP (5 MC) + Building tag (1-2 MC). Total ~15-19 MC. Good if requirement met.
Aqueduct Systems.reasoning: 3 Building card draw + 1 VP + Building tag for 12 MC in steel is good value, but the requirement (city adjacent to ocean) is awkward. You typically do not want cities near oceans, and building a city just for this is expensive. If the requirement happens to be met, the card is good. Building cards are hit-or-miss in quality. Niche but acceptable when stars align.
Aqueduct Systems.when_to_pick: Only when you already have a city next to an ocean and have steel to spend. Do not build around this card.

Bio Printing Facility.name: Bio Printing Facility
Bio Printing Facility.economy: 7+3=10 MC for Building tag (1-2 MC) + action: 2 energy -> 2 plants or 1 animal. With 1VP animal: ~5 MC/action. With plants: ~2 MC/action (plants vs heat).
Bio Printing Facility.reasoning: Cheap card with a flexible action, but requires energy production to function. The animal placement mode is strong with 1-VP-per-animal cards (Birds, Fish, Livestock) -- effectively converting 2 energy to 1 VP. The plant mode is mediocre since energy already converts to heat. Best as an animal feeder when you have excess energy from Mass Converter/Quantum Extractor. Without energy, useless.
Bio Printing Facility.when_to_pick: When you have 2+ excess energy-prod AND a 1-VP animal card. Otherwise low priority.

Deep Well Heating.name: Deep Well Heating
Deep Well Heating.economy: 13 MC (steel payable) + 3 MC card = 16 MC cost. Returns: 1 TR (~7.2 MC) + 1 energy-prod (~7.5 MC) + Power+Building tags (~3 MC). Total ~17.7 MC value. Tiny bundle discount.
Deep Well Heating.reasoning: Mediocre card that does two things you rarely need together. Per icehawk84, it's fair value but rarely what you want — if you need energy you pay for temperature you don't need, and vice versa. Per FieldMouse007, best use is holding it for later as a steel dump when you need a surprise heat/energy boost. The 2 tags (Power+Building) are its best feature.
Deep Well Heating.when_to_pick: When you have steel to dump and need both energy production and temperature advancement. Good early with steel resources.

Floating Habs.name: Floating Habs
Floating Habs.economy: 5 MC + 3 MC card = 8 MC cost. Action: spend 2 MC to add floater here OR add floater to any card. 1 VP per 2 floaters. 2 Science tag req. Venus tag.
Floating Habs.reasoning: Best VP-per-floater ratio (1 per 2), but on its own 2 MC per floater means 4 MC per VP which isn't great with an 8 MC investment. Per benbever, best use is as a floater distributor to other cards where floaters are worth more. The 2 Science tag requirement limits accessibility. Good with Titan colony for bulk floater dumps. Per community, not a high priority on its own but good in floater engines.
Floating Habs.when_to_pick: Mid game with Titan colony or 2+ floater dispensers. Good floater dump target for Hoverlord.

Fueled Generators.name: Fueled Generators
Fueled Generators.economy: 1 MC + 3 MC card = 4 MC cost. Net effect: -1 MC-prod (~-5 MC gen1) + 1 energy-prod (~7.5 MC gen1). Net gain: ~2.5 MC value gen1. Power+Building tags (~3 MC).
Fueled Generators.reasoning: Cheapest energy production in the game with useful dual tags. Per shai_aus, going on upfront cost it's the cheapest energy and cheapest building — if either matters, it's decent. Per ad_hocNC, it's a bad deal but energy 'now' has value. The -1 MC production hurts long-term but if you need immediate energy for cities, trading, or card effects, the 4 MC upfront cost is hard to beat. Better than SP Power Plant at 11 MC.
Fueled Generators.when_to_pick: Gen 1-2 when you urgently need energy production for another card and have no better energy source.

Gyropolis.name: Gyropolis
Gyropolis.economy: 20 MC + 14 MC (2 energy prod) + 3 MC card = ~37 MC total. Need 5+ Earth/Venus tags for 5+ MC-prod to break even. City worth ~2 VP. At 5 tags: 25 MC prod value + 10 MC city = 35 MC, barely even.
Gyropolis.reasoning: Very expensive city that requires significant Earth/Venus tag investment to justify. In 3P with all expansions, games are ~8 gen so production payoff window is narrow. Better in 2P with more gens. Steel payable is nice but energy cost hurts with Colonies trading.
Gyropolis.when_to_pick: Mid-late game steel dump when you have 5+ Earth/Venus tags and excess energy production. Good for Banker award snipe.

Imported GHG.name: Imported GHG
Imported GHG.economy: 7 MC + 3 MC card = 10 MC for 1 heat prod (~4-6 MC) + 3 heat (~3.75 MC) = ~8-10 MC value. Earth+Space event tags. Barely breaks even without discounts.
Imported GHG.reasoning: Marginal value on its own but excellent with discount infrastructure. The Earth+Space event triple-tag combo enables massive discounts. With Optimal Aerobraking alone it becomes profitable. The 3 instant heat can be clutch for sniping a temperature bonus. Low impact overall but very cheap and flexible.
Imported GHG.when_to_pick: When you have 2+ discount/rebate cards active. With Optimal Aerobraking, almost always play. Without discounts, it's marginal.

Mineral Deposit.name: Mineral Deposit
Mineral Deposit.economy: Cost 5+3=8 MC. Value: 5 steel (10 MC). Net +2 MC. No tags = penalty (-3 to -5). Event for Legend. Better with rebates.
Mineral Deposit.reasoning: Small but positive value if you can spend the steel. The no-tag penalty hurts significantly. With IC/Media Group rebates it becomes good. benbever notes it's good for Legend milestone and Miner award. Low impact but rarely bad. Not worth a high draft pick.
Mineral Deposit.when_to_pick: When you have event rebates or need steel for specific plays. Low draft priority. Good as free draw.

New Holland.name: New Holland
New Holland.economy: Cost 20+3=23 MC (steel payable). Value: 3 MC-prod (15-18) + City (placement VP) + City+Building tags (2-3). Req: 4 cities on Mars. Net ~-5 to -2.
New Holland.reasoning: Interesting concept but 4 cities on Mars requirement is very difficult to meet in 3P before good spots are gone. No COTD data available. The 3 MC-prod is decent and it's steel payable. Placing a city on an ocean tile is unique but the requirement severely limits playability. Niche promo card.
New Holland.when_to_pick: Only when 4+ cities exist on Mars AND good ocean spots remain for city placement. Very rare scenario.

Nitrogen from Titan.name: Nitrogen from Titan
Nitrogen from Titan.economy: Cost 25+3=28 MC (ti payable). Value: 2 TR (14.8) + 1 VP (5) + 2 floaters (~3) + Jovian+Space tags (4-7). Total ~27-30 MC. Break-even with tags.
Nitrogen from Titan.reasoning: A typical 'yet another Jovian' card. In isolation it's mediocre, but with multipliers and ti-discounts it becomes decent. The floaters on a Jovian card can add value (Jovian Lanterns for +1 VP). Krazyguy75 says at best it's good, never bad. Requires synergy to shine. Ti-payable helps in late game.
Nitrogen from Titan.when_to_pick: Late game with Jovian multipliers and titanium to spend. Low priority without specific synergy.

PR Office.name: PR Office
PR Office.economy: Cost 7+3=10 MC. Value: 1 TR (7-7.4) + 1 MC per Earth tag + Earth tag (2-3). Req: Unity ruling/2 delegates. At 3 Earth tags = 3 MC refund. Net ~0-3 MC.
PR Office.reasoning: Fairly priced TR with Earth tag refund. At 1 Earth tag (this one), it's 10 MC for 1 TR + 1 MC which is mediocre. With 4+ Earth tags it becomes good value. The Unity party requirement is manageable but limits flexibility. COTD has no key commenter data. A filler Turmoil card.
PR Office.when_to_pick: With 3+ Earth tags when Unity is ruling. Otherwise skip.

Recruitment.name: Recruitment
Recruitment.economy: 5 MC total (2+3) for replacing a neutral delegate with yours. Same cost as placing a delegate but more powerful (removes neutral). No tags = -3 to -5 penalty.
Recruitment.reasoning: Cheap political card that is strictly better than placing a delegate in certain situations. Can steal party leadership surprise. No tags hurts. Event tag useless. Very situational - depends on Turmoil board state. In 3P it can be powerful for stealing Chairman.
Recruitment.when_to_pick: When Turmoil is in play and you need to contest party leadership. Hold for optimal timing.

Satellites.name: Satellites
Satellites.economy: 13 MC total (10+3) for X MC-prod (1 per space tag including this). Space tag. Event space tags don't count. Need 3+ space tags for decent value.
Satellites.reasoning: Needs many non-event space tags to be worthwhile, which is difficult. shai_aus notes event space tags do not count, making it much weaker. Best for Banker award sniping. With 4+ space tags it gives 4+ MC-prod for 13 MC which is decent. Very niche and strategy-dependent. [BonelessDota] 'S-tier with goat (Saturn Systems).' In 3P with fewer space tags, value is lower. Score reflects 3P reality. Much stronger in 4-5P or with Saturn Systems/Phobolog.
Satellites.when_to_pick: When you have 3+ non-event space tags played. Can swing Banker award. Otherwise skip.

Trans-Neptune Probe.name: Trans-Neptune Probe
Trans-Neptune Probe.economy: 6+3=9 MC (ti-payable) for 1 VP (5 MC) + Science+Space tags (~5-7 MC). With ti: ~3-5 MC effective cost. Enables science requirements.
Trans-Neptune Probe.reasoning: Boring but functional. icehawk84 notes it's 'a cheap tag to unlock science payoffs.' FieldMouse007 calls it 'overpriced 1pt unless you have too much titanium.' The dual Science+Space tag is genuinely useful for requirements, making this mostly a tag enabler with a small VP bonus. Best when ti is available.
Trans-Neptune Probe.when_to_pick: When you need a science tag for requirements and have titanium to spend. Late game VP dump. Not a priority pick.

Tropical Resort.name: Tropical Resort
Tropical Resort.economy: 13+3=16 MC (steel-payable) for -2 heat-prod + 3 MC-prod + 2 VP. If heat-prod has no remaining value: 16 MC for 3 MC-prod (barely used) + 2 VP (10 MC). Building tag ~1-2 MC.
Tropical Resort.reasoning: Primarily a late-game VP card when temperature is maxed and heat production is worthless. benbever confirms 'definitely a late game card - use when you can't use your heat anymore.' 16 MC for 2 VP is below average but steel-payable helps. The 3 MC-prod helps with Banker. Not worth early play.
Tropical Resort.when_to_pick: Last gen or second to last when temperature is maxed and you have heat-prod to sacrifice. Steel-payable makes it cheaper.

Water Import From Europa.name: Water Import From Europa
Water Import From Europa.economy: 25+3=28 MC (ti-payable) for action: pay 12 MC (ti OK) for 1 ocean + 1 VP per Jovian tag. Jovian multiplier: at 4 tags = 4 VP (20 MC) + ocean action. Ocean at 12 MC vs SP 18 MC = 6 MC savings/use.
Water Import From Europa.reasoning: One of 4 Jovian multipliers. benbever's detailed analysis shows the ocean action is decent (6 MC under SP, ti-payable) but the real value is VP scaling. shai_aus calls it 'probably the worst Jovian multiplier' but FieldMouse007 notes 5+ VP makes it decent. Hate-draft priority against Jovian players. Flexible timing: can play early for oceans or late for VP.
Water Import From Europa.when_to_pick: In Jovian strategy for the multiplier VP. Hate-draft against Jovian players. Ocean action is bonus. Ti-payable is key.

Martian Lumber Corp.name: Martian Lumber Corp
Martian Lumber Corp.economy: 6+3=9 MC for 1 plant-prod (8 MC gen 1) + Building+Plant tags (3-4 MC) + effect: plants as 3 MC for Building. Requires 2 greeneries. Total value ~11-12 MC. Net +2 to +3 MC. But effect is a trap.
Martian Lumber Corp.reasoning: The NRA enabler value (Building+Plant tags) is the real draw. 1 plant-prod for 9 MC is slightly below average. The effect (plants as 3 MC for Building cards) sounds good but is actually a trap -- spending plants delays greeneries which are more valuable. You are converting 8 plants (1 greenery = 1 TR + 1 VP = ~12 MC) into 24 MC of Building discount, which sounds better but only if you have huge plant-prod AND enough Building cards. The 2-greenery requirement also means mid-game play at earliest.
Martian Lumber Corp.when_to_pick: For Building+Plant tag combo enabling NRA. Ignore the effect in most cases -- it is a trap. Best gen 3-4 with 2 greeneries already placed.

Airliners.name: Airliners
Airliners.economy: 11+3=14 MC for 2 MC-prod (10-12 MC gen 1) + 2 floaters (2-4 MC) + 1 VP (5 MC). Requires 3 floaters. No tags (-3 to -5 MC). Total value ~17-21 MC. Net +3 to +7 MC but req is the gate.
Airliners.reasoning: Decent value if requirement is met -- 2 MC-prod + 2 floaters + VP for 14 MC. But the 3-floater requirement AND no tags both drag it down. You need a floater engine already running (Dirigibles, Aerial Mappers, etc.) to meet the requirement. No tags means zero synergy value. The 2 floaters added help floater engines but you already need floaters to play this. Circular dependency. Acquired Company gives similar MC-prod with an Earth tag for less cost. Only worth it in deep floater strategies.
Airliners.when_to_pick: Only with active floater engine providing 3+ floaters. The MC-prod + VP is decent payoff but no tags and requirement gate limit it. Skip without floater infrastructure.

ArchaeBacteria.name: ArchaeBacteria
ArchaeBacteria.economy: 6+3=9 MC for 1 plant-prod (8 MC gen 1). Microbe tag worth 1-2 MC. Max -18C easy to meet gen 1. 9 MC total, ~9-10 MC value. Fair.
ArchaeBacteria.reasoning: Cheapest plant production in the game at 9 MC total, but gives a Microbe tag instead of the more valuable Plant tag. The max -18C requirement is almost always met gen 1. Fair value as a gen 1 play to start greenery accumulation, but 1 plant-prod alone does little -- you need additional plant sources. The Microbe tag has niche synergy with Decomposers, Advanced Ecosystems.
synergies: Nitrogen Rich Asteroid (needs plant tag instead)
ArchaeBacteria.when_to_pick: Gen 1 only, when you need cheap plant production and have no better options. The Microbe tag is less useful than Plant tag.

Artificial Photosynthesis.name: Artificial Photosynthesis
Artificial Photosynthesis.economy: 12+3=15 MC for Science tag (3-5 MC) + 2 energy-prod (15 MC) or 1 plant-prod (8 MC). Energy mode: 7.5 MC/prod, slightly above average.
Artificial Photosynthesis.reasoning: Overpriced for production alone, but the Science tag adds value. 2 energy-prod for 15 MC (7.5 MC each) is acceptable but not good -- Geothermal Power and Solar Wind Power are better deals. The plant-prod option is terrible (15 MC for 1 plant-prod). Mainly played for the Science tag when you need energy production and a science requirement. Functional but uninspiring.
Artificial Photosynthesis.when_to_pick: When you need a Science tag AND 2 energy-prod. Otherwise find cheaper energy or better Science tags.

Giant Space Mirror.name: Giant Space Mirror
Giant Space Mirror.economy: 17 MC + 3 MC card = 20 MC cost. Returns: 3 energy-prod (~22.5 MC gen1) + Space tag (~2 MC). Total ~24.5 MC. Efficiency: 6.7 MC per energy-prod.
Giant Space Mirror.reasoning: Overpriced energy production. 20 MC for 3 energy-prod is better per-unit than SP Power Plant but the bulk cost is painful. Per benbever in other COTD threads, it's rarely worth playing unless you can pay significant portion in titanium. The Space tag enables ti payment which is the main draw. There are usually better energy sources available. Colonies make energy more valuable but 20 MC gen1 is a lot.
Giant Space Mirror.when_to_pick: Gen 1-2 with titanium to pay and immediate need for 3 energy (Colonies, multiple energy-dependent cards).

Grass.name: Grass
Grass.economy: 11 MC + 3 MC card = 14 MC cost. Returns: 1 plant-prod (~8 MC gen1) + 3 plants (~6 MC) + Plant tag (~2 MC). Total ~16 MC. Requires -16°C.
Grass.reasoning: Basic plant card with easy requirement. The 3 immediate plants plus 1 plant-prod is modest but playable early when plants help toward greeneries. Per community, plant production cards are generally mediocre in all-expansion games because games are shorter. At 14 MC it's slightly below break-even for gen 1 play. The Plant tag helps NRA and Ecologist. Similar to but worse than Bushes (same cost, 2 plant-prod instead of 1 + 4 plants).
Grass.when_to_pick: Gen 1-3 with plant synergy and a path to early greeneries. Not worth keeping for late game.

SF Memorial.name: SF Memorial
SF Memorial.economy: 10 MC total (7+3) for 1 card (~4 MC) + 1 VP (~5 MC) + Building tag (~1 MC). Total value ~10 MC. Break-even. Steel payable.
SF Memorial.reasoning: Simple, boring card. 10 MC for 1 card + 1 VP is fair but uninspiring. Building tag helps for milestones. Best as a steel dump. shai_aus says 'maybe if desperate.' icehawk84 confirms 'not hugely impactful.' Free draw makes it more playable since you save the 3 MC draft cost.
SF Memorial.when_to_pick: Late game steel dump for 1 VP. Not worth drafting early unless desperate for building tags.

Wave Power.name: Wave Power
Wave Power.economy: 8+3=11 MC for 1 energy-prod (7.5 MC) + 1 VP (5 MC) + Power tag (~1 MC). Req 3 oceans. Total ~13.5 MC. Slight value gain. Steel-payable helps.
Wave Power.reasoning: Cheap energy production with a VP bonus. 11 MC for 1 energy-prod + 1 VP is acceptable efficiency. The 3 ocean requirement is usually met by gen 3-4. Power tag is niche. In Colonies, energy for trading adds value. A decent filler card that's never exciting but rarely terrible.
Wave Power.when_to_pick: When you need energy production and 3 oceans are down. Fine filler. Better with Colonies.

Supermarkets.name: Supermarkets
Supermarkets.economy: 9+3=12 MC for 2 MC-prod (10-12 MC gen 1) + 1 VP (5 MC). Requires 2 cities. No tags (-3 to -5 MC). Total value ~15-17 MC. Net +3 to +5 MC. But requirement + no tags limits playability.
Supermarkets.reasoning: 2 MC-prod + 1 VP for 12 MC is fair rate, but the 2-city requirement and no tags make it strictly worse than Acquired Company (3 MC-prod + Earth tag for 13 MC, no requirement). You need 2 cities already placed which typically means gen 3-4 at earliest, reducing MC-prod compounding time. No tags provides zero synergy value. The 1 VP partially compensates but does not save the card. Only playable when requirements are already met and nothing better is available.
Supermarkets.when_to_pick: Only when 2 cities already placed and you need MC-prod. Strictly worse than Acquired Company. Skip if better MC-prod options exist.

Ants.name: Ants
Ants.economy: 9+3=12 MC for Microbe tag + action: 1/2 VP per microbe. Self-generating: ~3-4 VP over 6-7 gens (play gen 2-3). Anti-microbe attack is bonus.
Ants.reasoning: Decent VP generator with 1/2 VP per microbe, but slow (1 microbe per gen via action). 4% oxygen requirement is mild. The anti-microbe ability is situational -- sometimes strong (stealing from Decomposers, Tardigrades) but often no good targets. Best with Extreme-Cold Fungus, Enceladus colony, Bactoviral Research. Without these, ~3 VP for 12 MC is merely acceptable.
Ants.when_to_pick: When you have microbe synergy (Enceladus, Extreme-Cold Fungus) or opponents have vulnerable microbe cards. Mid-priority.

Cloud Tourism.name: Cloud Tourism
Cloud Tourism.economy: 11+3=14 MC for Venus tag (2-3 MC) + MC-prod per Earth/Venus pair. With 2 pairs: 2 MC-prod (10 MC). 1/3 VP per floater is slow. Action adds floaters.
Cloud Tourism.reasoning: Requires both Earth AND Venus tag investment to generate meaningful MC-prod, which is a narrow niche. The 1/3 VP per floater is very slow. With 2 Earth+Venus pairs, 2 MC-prod for 14 MC is fair but requires substantial tag investment. The floater generation helps with Hoverlord milestone. Mostly for dedicated Venus+Earth crossover strategies which are uncommon. Niche but functional.
Cloud Tourism.when_to_pick: When you have 2+ Earth tags AND 2+ Venus tags. Very niche. Skip without dual-tag investment.

Community Services.name: Community Services
Community Services.economy: 13+3=16 MC for 1 VP (5 MC) + N MC-prod where N = no-tag cards (including this). Average 2-3 no-tag cards: 2-3 MC-prod (10-15 MC). No tags = -3 to -5.
Community Services.reasoning: The no-tag penalty is somewhat mitigated since the card actively rewards having no-tag cards. With 3 no-tag cards (including itself) you get 3 MC-prod + 1 VP for 16 MC, which is acceptable. But building around no-tag cards is generally a losing strategy since tags are valuable. Best as a side benefit when you happen to have several no-tag cards (Caretaker Contract, Indentured Workers, etc.). The Sagitta corp synergy is notable.
Community Services.when_to_pick: When you have 3+ no-tag cards already. Not worth building around.

Geothermal Power.name: Geothermal Power
Geothermal Power.economy: 11 MC + 3 MC card = 14 MC cost. Returns: 2 energy-prod (~15 MC gen1) + Power+Building tags (~3 MC). Total ~18 MC. Efficiency: 7 MC per energy-prod.
Geothermal Power.reasoning: Straightforward energy production card at fair but unexciting value. 14 MC for 2 energy production is ~7 MC per energy-prod, which is the same as SP Power Plant (11 MC for 1) after accounting for the card cost. The Power+Building tags provide some tag synergy. Per community, it's playable but rarely exciting — you'd rather find energy from cheaper sources or cards that do more than just give energy.
Geothermal Power.when_to_pick: Gen 1-3 when you need energy production and nothing better is available. Steel payable helps.

Luxury Foods.name: Luxury Foods
Luxury Foods.economy: 8 MC + 3 MC card = 11 MC for 2 VP (~10 MC). Requires Venus+Earth+Jovian tags. No tags = -3 to -5 penalty. 5.5 MC/VP.
Luxury Foods.reasoning: Mediocre VP card with no tags. At 5.5 MC per VP it's slightly above the 5 MC/VP threshold but the triple tag requirement and no tags on the card itself make it unexciting. Good last-gen point dump if requirements are met. The requirements are usually met naturally with all expansions. No ongoing value, pure VP. Not worth going out of your way for.
Luxury Foods.when_to_pick: Last gen point dump when you meet the requirements and have nothing better. Don't draft unless requirements are easy.

Phobos Space Haven.name: Phobos Space Haven
Phobos Space Haven.economy: Cost 25+3=28 MC (ti payable). Value: 3 VP (15) + 1 ti-prod (12.5) + Space+City tags (2-3) + city (no Mars bonuses). Total ~30-31 MC. Net ~+2-3 MC but ti-prod is often wasted late.
Phobos Space Haven.reasoning: 3 VP for 28 MC (ti payable) is okay as late-game titanium dump, but the 1 titanium production is wasted if played late. The city isn't on Mars so it doesn't count for most awards/milestones. shai_aus rates it too expensive and bad value. icehawk84 prefers Interstellar Colony Ship. Only play as an endgame titanium dump.
Phobos Space Haven.when_to_pick: Last 1-2 gens as titanium dump for 3 VP. Don't play for production -- too slow.

Physics Complex.name: Physics Complex
Physics Complex.economy: Cost 12+3=15 MC (steel payable). Action: 6 energy -> 2 VP. At 3 uses = 6 VP for 15 + ~18 energy cost = 33 MC total. 5.5 MC/VP. Science+Building tags (4-7).
Physics Complex.reasoning: The 'newbie trap' card that looks amazing but is usually mediocre. 6 energy per action is an enormous cost that could be used for temperature/trading. icehawk84 notes it's a scaling late-game card but warns against early play. SoupsBane calculates 4 uses minimum for playability. The Science+Building tags are the best part. Only good with Mass Converter-level energy surplus.
Physics Complex.when_to_pick: Only with 6+ energy production and no better use for it. The tags alone can justify it as a steel dump.

Robot Pollinators.name: Robot Pollinators
Robot Pollinators.economy: 12 MC total (9+3) for 1 plant prod (~8 MC) + X plants (1 per plant tag). No tags = -3 to -5 penalty. Req 4% oxygen. Worse Insects without plant tag.
Robot Pollinators.reasoning: Mediocre plant production card without a plant tag, which is a significant downside (no NRA/Insects synergy). The plant-per-tag bonus is variable and often small. benbever confirms it has no plant tag despite appearances. No tag penalty hurts. Comparable to Grass but strictly worse than Insects.
Robot Pollinators.when_to_pick: Only when you have many plant tags and need the extra plants for a greenery. Low priority.

Special Permit.name: Special Permit
Special Permit.economy: 8 MC total (5+3) for steal 4 plants from opponent + Plant event tag. Req: Greens ruling or 2 delegates. Take-that in 3P. 4 stolen plants = 0.5 greenery swing.
Special Permit.reasoning: Take-that card in 3P format deserves penalty. Stealing 4 plants hurts one opponent but benefits the third for free. Greens requirement adds timing difficulty. Plant tag is nice for synergies. Not as bad as pure take-that cards since you gain the plants yourself, making it a resource transfer rather than pure destruction. Very situational.
Special Permit.when_to_pick: Only when Greens are ruling and you can immediately use the stolen plants. Niche.

Supercapacitors.name: Supercapacitors
Supercapacitors.economy: 4+3=7 MC for 1 MC-prod (5-6 MC) + energy storage ability + Power+Building tags. Tags for Aridor/Diversifier worth ~2-4 MC. Energy storage helps with Colony trading.
Supercapacitors.reasoning: Cheap card with useful dual tags. The 1 MC-prod alone almost justifies the cost. Energy storage is niche but helpful for Colonies trading when you have 2 energy-prod. benbever details good use cases. Mostly a tag card with a small production bonus. Fine but low impact.
Supercapacitors.when_to_pick: When tags matter (Diversifier, Builder milestones) or with Colonies and limited energy. Cheap enough to play most times.

Water to Venus.name: Water to Venus
Water to Venus.economy: 9+3=12 MC (ti-payable) for 1 Venus TR (9 MC). Space event tag. With discounts (IC -2, space discounts -2 to -4): can be 2-6 MC for 1 TR. With Optimal Aerobraking: +3 heat bonus.
Water to Venus.reasoning: icehawk84 says 'efficient with all possible discounts and rebates but never exciting.' benbever details how with discounts/ti this can be near-free TR. FieldMouse007 calls it 'ok card, cheaper standard project.' The Space event tag makes it flexible for Legend, IC, Media Group. Not bad, just unexciting - a discount-dependent card.
Water to Venus.when_to_pick: When you have space/event discounts and need Venus TR. Ti-payable makes it accessible. Late-game ti dump.

Windmills.name: Windmills
Windmills.economy: 6+3=9 MC (steel-payable) for 1 energy-prod (7.5 MC) + 1 VP (5 MC) + Power+Building tags (~2-3 MC). Req 7% O2. Total ~15 MC. Very cheap with steel.
Windmills.reasoning: shai_aus says 'it's fine. Pretty cheap, gives you a point, lets you use excess steel.' Power+Building dual tags are useful for Builder milestone and energy needs. 7% O2 requirement (step 10/14) limits to mid-late game. With steel payment it's very cheap for 1 VP + energy. Modest but efficient.
Windmills.when_to_pick: When 7% O2 is met and you have steel. Cheap VP + energy. Fine filler for late game.

Biomass Combustors.name: Biomass Combustors
Biomass Combustors.economy: 4+3=7 MC for 2 energy-prod (14 MC gen 1) - 1 VP (5 MC) - take-that penalty (steal plant-prod). Power+Building tags (4-6 MC). 6% O2 req. Net +6-8 MC. But take-that in 3P: -5 to -10.
Biomass Combustors.reasoning: Cheap 2 energy-prod with good Power+Building tags, but the -1 VP and mandatory plant-prod steal hurt significantly. The take-that aspect in 3P helps the third player, which is the cardinal sin of multiplayer strategy. Power+Building dual tag is premium for requirements and steel payability. The 6% O2 requirement is moderate. At 7 MC for 2 energy-prod the rate is excellent (3.5 MC/prod) but the -1 VP and social cost bring it down. Best when the plant-prod steal targets someone already losing.
Biomass Combustors.when_to_pick: Gen 2-4 when you desperately need energy-prod and the plant-prod steal targets the leader. Power+Building tags are the draw. Skip if take-that would help a rival.

House Printing.name: House Printing
House Printing.economy: 10+3=13 MC for 1 steel-prod (7.5 MC gen 1 at 2 MC/steel + Building bonus) + 1 VP (5 MC) + Building tag (steel-payable). Total value ~12-13 MC. Net -1 to 0 MC. Break-even at best.
House Printing.reasoning: 1 steel-prod for 13 MC is slightly overpriced. Steel-prod value depends on Building card availability -- with many Building targets, steel is worth 3-4 MC each (9-12 MC/prod) making this decent. Without Building targets, steel sits unused. 1 VP and Building tag add moderate value. Steel-payable via Building tag helps but at 2 steel = 8 MC saving, the effective cost drops to ~5 MC which is better. Overall a marginal card that breaks even at best. Not bad but not exciting.
House Printing.when_to_pick: Gen 1-2 with Building-heavy strategy and steel consumers. Steel-payable reduces cost. Skip gen 3+ or without Building card targets for the steel.

Air-Scrapping Expedition.name: Air-Scrapping Expedition
Air-Scrapping Expedition.economy: 13+3=16 MC for 1 Venus TR (7 MC) + 3 floaters (~3-4.5 MC). Net ~10.5 MC, overpays by ~5.5 MC. Ti-payable. Event tag has synergy value.
Air-Scrapping Expedition.reasoning: Slightly cheaper than the Venus standard project (15 MC), with 3 bonus floaters and a Venus tag. The floaters add value if you have Stratopolis, Floating Habs, or Hoverlord milestone. Without floater targets, it is mediocre -- paying 16 MC for 1 TR is poor. The Venus event tag enables Media Group, Optimal Aerobraking synergies. Situational but acceptable with the right floater cards.
Air-Scrapping Expedition.when_to_pick: When you have Venus floater cards in play and need a Venus raise. Skip without floater synergy.

City Parks.name: City Parks
City Parks.economy: 7+3=10 MC for 2 VP (10 MC) + 2 plants (4 MC) + Building tag (1-2 MC). Total ~15 MC. Requires 3 cities. Building tag, steel-payable.
City Parks.reasoning: 2 VP + 2 plants for 10 MC is good value, but the 3 cities requirement is very hard to meet. Most players play 1-2 cities in a typical 3P game. You need to be specifically building cities for this to work, which is generally not an efficient strategy. If you happen to have 3 cities (rare), the card is cheap VP. Steel-payable is nice. Too conditional for most games.
City Parks.when_to_pick: Only when you have or expect 3 cities, which is rare in 3P. Do not build cities to enable this.

Comet Aiming.name: Comet Aiming
Comet Aiming.economy: 17+3=20 MC for Space tag. Action: 1 ti -> 1 asteroid (2 gens = 1 ocean). 1st ocean: 23 MC (including 1 ti). Better than Aquifer Pumping rate but still slow.
Comet Aiming.reasoning: Better than Aquifer Pumping but still expensive upfront (20 MC). Converting titanium to oceans every 2 gens is decent if you have ti-production. With Astrodrill or external asteroid sources, much better (1 ocean per gen). Without asteroid synergy, ~2-3 oceans over the game for ~25-30 MC total is acceptable but not exciting. Space tag is useful. Main value is with asteroid card combos.
Comet Aiming.when_to_pick: When you have ti-production and asteroid card synergy. Medium priority with Astrodrill. Lower without.

Comet for Venus.name: Comet for Venus
Comet for Venus.economy: 11+3=14 MC for 1 Venus TR (7 MC) + remove 4 MC from Venus-tagged player (~2-4 MC value in 3P). Space tag (1-2 MC). Ti-payable. Event synergies.
Comet for Venus.reasoning: 1 MC cheaper than Venus standard project, with a minor attack. In 3P the MC removal helps the third player (take-that penalty). Ti-payable via Space tag. Event tag enables synergies. Mostly played as a cheap Venus raise with ti payment and event rebates. Without discounts, barely better than the standard project. The attack is too minor and conditional to matter much.
Comet for Venus.when_to_pick: When you need a Venus raise and have ti/event discounts. Skip without discounts.

Directed Impactors.name: Directed Impactors
Directed Impactors.economy: 8 MC + 3 MC card = 11 MC cost. Action: 6 MC (ti payable) → 1 asteroid → spend for 1 temp raise. Effective: ~17 MC per TR (11 initial + 6 per use). With ti: cheaper.
Directed Impactors.reasoning: A mediocre terraforming engine. 6 MC + 2 actions per TR is slow and expensive compared to standard projects. Per FieldMouse007, needs to raise temperature at least 2-3 times to be playable. Per icehawk84, asteroid cards tend to eat titanium needed for better things. The Space tag and ti payability help somewhat. Only worth it if rushing temperature early with titanium to spare.
Directed Impactors.when_to_pick: Gen 1-2 if rushing temperature with excess titanium. Skip if mid-game or later.

Greenhouses.name: Greenhouses
Greenhouses.economy: 6 MC (steel payable) + 3 MC card = 9 MC cost. Returns: X plants where X = cities in play. In 3P mid-game typically 2-4 cities = 2-4 plants (~4-8 MC). Plant+Building tags (~3 MC).
Greenhouses.reasoning: Cheap one-shot plant generator that scales with cities. In 3P with 3-4 cities, you get 3-4 plants for 9 MC which is barely break-even. The Plant+Building tags help NRA and Builder. Per community, it's a late-game play when more cities are down and plants are worth more for final greenery conversions. Very dependent on city count which varies widely. Steel payable is nice. [BonelessDota] 'Deceptively strong. 8 cities = greenery for 6 MC. Perfect last gen play.' In 3P late game with 6-8 cities, this converts to a near-free greenery (1 TR + 1 VP). Steel payable makes it even cheaper.
Greenhouses.when_to_pick: Late game with 5+ cities for a final plant burst toward greenery conversion. Low priority otherwise.

Hired Raiders.name: Hired Raiders
Hired Raiders.economy: 1 MC + 3 MC card = 4 MC cost. Steal 2 steel (~4 MC) or 3 MC. Nearly cost-neutral. No tags = -3 to -5 penalty.
Hired Raiders.reasoning: Almost breaks even on its own which is rare for attack cards. In 3P, stealing from one opponent helps the third player, but the near-zero net cost mitigates this. No tags is a significant penalty. Better in 2P. With IC/Media Group it becomes genuinely profitable. The steal can disrupt key steel plays.
Hired Raiders.when_to_pick: When you have event rebates or need to disrupt a specific opponent's steel plans. Don't draft early without synergies.

Hydrogen to Venus.name: Hydrogen to Venus
Hydrogen to Venus.economy: 11 MC + 3 MC card = 14 MC for 1 Venus TR (~7 MC). Floaters are conditional on Jovian tags AND Venus floater card. Space tag for titanium payment. Without floaters: 7 MC value for 14 MC = bad.
Hydrogen to Venus.reasoning: Overpriced Venus TR without the floater bonus. Requires both Jovian tags AND a Venus floater card to get good value, which is an unlikely combo. As a titanium dump for 1 Venus TR it's barely passable at 14 MC (vs 15 MC standard project). The Space tag and ti-payable save it from F-tier. Highly situational.
Hydrogen to Venus.when_to_pick: Only when you have Jovian tags AND a Venus floater card. Otherwise, pass.

Ironworks.name: Ironworks
Ironworks.economy: 11 MC + 3 MC card = 14 MC upfront. Action: 4 energy (~6 MC) for 1 O2 step (7 MC TR) + 1 steel (2 MC) = ~9 MC value. Net per use: +3 MC. Need 4+ uses to pay off the card.
Ironworks.reasoning: Niche oxygen bumper that requires significant energy investment. In 3P with all expansions, energy is often needed for colony trading, making the 4 energy per use expensive. Need 4+ bumps to break even, which requires ~5 gens of use. Better in 2P where there's less competition for oxygen track and more generations. The Building tag and steel output are minor bonuses.
Ironworks.when_to_pick: When you have 4+ energy production with no colony trading needs and want to compete on oxygen track. Mostly a 2P card.

Local Shading.name: Local Shading
Local Shading.economy: 4 MC + 3 MC card = 7 MC. Venus tag. Action: add 1 floater or spend 1 floater for +1 MC-prod. Effectively: 1 MC-prod per 2 actions, but can receive floaters from other sources.
Local Shading.reasoning: Cheap Venus tag with a slow MC production engine. Building MC-prod one at a time over 2 actions is extremely slow, but the card is so cheap that even 2-3 MC-prod over the game is acceptable. Better as a floater target for other cards. The Venus tag has synergy value. Cheap enough to play just for the tag without feeling bad.
Local Shading.when_to_pick: When you need a cheap Venus tag or a floater target. The MC-prod generation is a bonus, not the primary reason.

Magnetic Field Generators:promo.name: Magnetic Field Generators:promo
